text.en_US: Played the game for 10 hours. What an incredible feat.
A bright and lush area painted in the warm colors of autumn.
The small guild village sometimes called "Hidden Leaf".
An abandoned Observatory, now crawling with enemies.
Western Exit leading to Rookie Harbor.
Exit to the rural Bergen Trail area.
A memorial of unknown purpose in the center of Autumn's Rise.
A rural area leading up to the cold town of Bergen.
An lonesome house, commonly used as half-way break from the difficult climb.
This landmark is only a few steps away from Bergen Village! You can do it!
The base of \v[area.bergen-trails.name]. Often used as a preparation spot before the climb.
A sleepy village hidden in the snowy heights of Mount Berg.
Once an Inn this landmark now serves as library an official bureau.
Checkpoint for tired travelers who just finished the climb on \v[area.bergen-trails.name].
One of the many cargo ships belonging to the maintenance crew of CrossWorlds.
A once busy Mine with an uncovered temple crawling with hostile robots.
This is where everything goes that is not wanted.
The final tutorial dungeon teaching players the basics of CrossWorlds.
The pulsating heart of CrossWorlds. Only accessible for advanced players.
A bustling city positively bursting with life, start of many adventures for new players.
The entrance to Rookie Harbor from Cross Central.
A beautiful fountain sitting in the center of the busy marketplace.
Hey, how can ye read this? This is not part of the bloody playground, ye dobber!
Testing a landmark, is like testing a landmark. I have text.
Let's see how those \v[combat.name.hedgehog] will fare!
...Lea?\. I think I need a break.
Do you ever plan to stop, Lea?
How about some live and let live, Lea?
Mon dieu! You just keep going!
Do you ever wonder what kind of music those things are listening to?
They do seem very much into it, non?
They were cute at first, now they're just annoying.
Huh. Did we just beat up a cow with some kind of iron mask?
We used to have cows in the neighborhood when I was a child.
I kinda liked the cows in our neighbourhood.\. They were cute.
Oui, those buffalos are rough in comparison, but still.\. Feeling sorta bad about this.
I used to see cows everyday on my way to school.
After some time I think they even started recognizing me!
Did you ever drink fresh cow milk? It's délicieux!
I actually once milked a cow myself! Sorta weird feeling at the beginning.
Hey, you're not doing this to mess with me, oui?
Wait...\. Yes.\. What do you mean with this?
Learn how to use \c[3]Melee Arts\c[0] in combat.
Press and hold \i[special] to charge the attack.

You can change your \c[3]direction\c[0] while charging.
Release \i[special] again to execute the attack.
Learn how to use \c[3]Throw Arts\c[0] in combat.
While aiming press and hold \i[special] to charge the attack.
You can change the direction while charging.
Release \i[special] again to execute the attack.
Learn how to use \c[3]Dash Arts\c[0] in combat.
And at the \c[3]same time\c[0] hold \i[special] to charge the Dash Art.
Release \i[special] again to execute the attack.
Learn how to use \c[3]Guard Arts\c[0] in combat.
While you guard, press and hold \i[special] to charge the Guard Art.
Release \i[special] again to execute the attack.
Learn how to view and track your \c[3]Quests\c[0].
You can see all your quest within the \c[3]synopsis menu\c[0].
Focus a quest to see details on the left.
You can see more details by selecting a quest.
The current task of the marked quest will be displayed in your HUD.
You can change the marked quest outside the menu by \c[3]pressing\c[0] \i[left-stick] and \i[right-stick].
You can change the marked quest outside the menu with \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
I'm back to kick some ass!
I see there are still enemies left for me!
Hmpf... I gotta do more practice.
Excellent! Got new gear to punch enemies even harder!
Lea, look at the new stuff I just bought!
Getting closer to the ultimate punching machine, one step after the other!
I got new gear! Too bad your appearance doesn't change, non?
Good luck in that dungeon!\. See you again outside!
Welcome back! Found treasure par excellence?
Uhm, hey Lea. Why the DL? I'm in your party, non?
Just before I saw a group of \c[3]penguins\c[0]!
I'm preeeetty sure that penguins are usually not around mountains.
Bonjour! I'm currently in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0] enjoying the landscape.
Yes! Party time! Une seconde, I'll be right there!
I see you're looking for a formidable punching force. I'm ready!
It's time for chakrams and fists to role over the field!
That was fun! Any time again!
Awww, already? Well...\. see you soon!

You just loaded an \c[3]old save file\c[0].
\c[3]Things might be broken!\c[0]
However, we can try to continue the story from when things changed! You will keep your level and items.

Do you want to continue the story?

This large hedgehog creature can usually be found in packs of up to 20. Normally it is peaceful but when provoked it will use its sharp needles to attack its predator. 
No one really knows why it was named \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]\c[0]. Some say it was a typo when the enemy was first named and someone people stuck with it. Other say it stirs from it's violent nature when provoked in packs.
According to some players defeating multiple \v[combat.name.hedgehog]s in a certain area of \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0] will lead to a rare event.

This strange bug hides inside rocks to lure on its prey. It attacks everything without warning. Despite its short height it capable of inflicting dangerous wounds by dashing towards its mark with great speed. The attacks are also cold based which makes them an even larger thread.

This littler bugger is actually a cybernetic parasite capable of taking over mechanical systems. Once infested the machines are used to fight off hostiles and expand the colony. To fight them off your best bet is fire since these bugs are extremely vulnerable to heat. So basically like every bug. Kill it with fire.

This large hedgehog creature can usually be found in packs of up to 20. Normally it is peaceful but when provoked it will use its sharp needles to attack its predator. 
No one really knows why it was named \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]\c[0]. Some say it was a typo when the enemy was first named and someone people stuck with it. Other say it stirs from it's violent nature when provoked in packs.

In an unknown area at an unknown time a woman called \c[3]Shizuka\c[0] materialized. She demanded to know where her brother \c[3]Satoshi\c[0] was and why they were holding him captive. 
As she moved towards her destination she was interrupted by an \c[3]obfuscated man\c[0] using fiends that Shizuka had to defeat. Thanks to her skill she quickly disposed of the enemies and found herself in front of a large building.

At the end of a hallway she found her brother in front of a computer system. He seemed to work on something as Shizuka was urging him to stop because of his poor health. 
However Satoshi stated that it was already to late for him and as he finished his work he collapsed on the floor. Shocked, Shizuka ran to him, but it was, as Satoshi said, already to late.

\c[3]Lea\c[0] awoke in a strange environment. She couldn't remember how she got there or who she was and also had no time to think about since she was greeted by a floating display in front of her. It showed \c[3]Sergey\c[0] who told her that her "initialization" was successful and asked if she can understand him.
However Lea couldn't talk. She wanted to, but her \c[3]speech module\c[0] seemed to be broken according to Sergej.

Without delay he asked her to perform some simple tasks to understand the "gameplay" mechanics. Lea mastered each task with ease, almost as if she already knew what to do.
After finishing the final challenge she met \c[3]Carla\c[0] who welcomed her the "cargo hold".

Without any explanation Lea had to fulfill several other challenges, none of them proving a challenge. But she also grew more restless and as the final challenge was completed Carla and Sergey promised Lea to tell her everything as soon as they spoke with \c[3]Captain Jet\c[0].
The captain welcomed Lea to the ship but stated that she had to leave as soon as possible because an \c[3]Avatar\c[0] on board of his ship just "calls for darn trouble". Nevertheless he promised to teach her some tricks later.

As Carla and Lea stepped outside, it became clear that they were on board of a ship with the name \c[3]M.S. Solar\c[0]. They moved ahead to the bow of the boat and Sergey gave Lea a explanation of her situation.

As it turned out, Lea was actually inside a game called \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0] which takes place on a real planet. Lea is inside the body of an \c[3]Avatar\c[0] which is tightly connected to all her senses. Sergey went on by saying that they hoped to recover her memory by letting her play the game since there is a high chance that it might help. 
Carla added that everyone on deck except her is actually human and belongs to the maintenance crew of the game.

After the explanation Sergey surprised Lea by giving her the ability to say certain words that he "hardcodes" into the system (\c[3]"Hi"\c[0] in this case). They moved on and met the captain in the cabins where he told Lea to get up to the balcony in order to start the combat training.

While the captain showed Lea special combat mechanics they were interrupted by a \c[3]mysterious man\c[0]. As he floated in midair he claimed that something was not right on this ship and quickly turned to Lea as the source of the anomaly. He approached her and was about to "erase" her. However he noticed something peculiar about Lea and threw her on top of the cargo containers to "test her abilities and see if he is right about her".

A \c[3]\v[combat.name.boss-test]\c[0] appears out of thin air and got ready to attack Lea. Sergey dropped in and told Lea to take on the enemy as his "stats match those of Lea". 
Taking a deep breather Lea nodded and prepared to fight the crab. After a tough fight she came out on top and stared up to the mysterious man floating in the air.

He was overjoyed with the result of his challenge and was about to finally take Lea away with him as captain Jet intervened by using the \c[3]Solar Fist\c[0] which disrupted parts of the mans arm. 
The captain quickly grabbed Lea and flew her back to the balcony where she was told to escape back to the teleporter she awoke in.

Together with Carla, Lea returned to the cargo hold but is stopped by a display of the floating man who summoned enemies to stop her. The enemies were far above Lea's level so Sergey told her to just run to the teleporter instead of fighting. Just before the enemies could catch Lea she stepped into the teleporter and took a final look at Carla who then activated it.

After narrowly escaping the \c[3]mysterious blue man\c[0] on the \c[3]M.S. Solar\c[0], Lea arrived on \c[3]Newcomer's Bridge\c[0] in \c[3]Rhombus Square\c[0] via teleportation. Sergey explained about the tight security measures of that loaction, part relieved because the blue individual would be unable to interfere again but also worried because Lea had to pass as a real player. He also promised to unlock new words for her soon to make that task easier.

On the way to the \c[3]Rhombus Dungeon\c[0], a last test for new players before arriving at the mainland, Lea bumped into a the feisty redhead who was also a fellow rookie. Being a competetive lass, she instantly challenged Lea to a race through the dungeon which they both promptly started. Without noticing trouble entering behind them...

Using the skills she learned on the ship and her own wits, Lea managed to beat the Dungeon while picking up new abilities along the way. In the meantime Sergey was inquiring over the situation on the M.S. Solar and the identity of the blue man. While the crew of the ship was fine, he was unable to procure anything about their mysterious attacker.

After unlocking the largest update, the Circuit, Sergey finally added the second word to Lea's language: Her own name, \c[3]"Lea"\c[0]. Twice as eloquent but still disappointed, Lea left the dungeon to talk to the girl who challenged her to the race before and just narrowly beat her. She introduced herself as \c[3]Emilie\c[0], or \c[3]Emilienator\c[0] as her nickname whereupon Lea used her newfound vocabulary to introduce herself in turn.

The friendly conversation was cut short, though, as a fancy guy named \c[3]Apollo\c[0] entered the scene in a thirst for "justice". He accused Lea of cheating because her level was higher than usual at that point (thanks to the unplanned fight against the crab) and wanted her to atone. The situation was diffused, however, as his friend \c[3]Joern\c[0] appeared and apologized for Apollo, before leaving with the protesting vigilante in tow.

Lea and Emilie moved on from the confusing scene by taking the \c[3]Skyrails\c[0] to \c[3]CrossCentral\c[0], the main teleportation HUB of CrossWorlds. There they took the only way to the mainland that was available to new playes in the beginning, the teleporter to the coastal town \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0].

Shortly after arriving in the cozy beginner's town the two were surprised by a player called \c[3]Schneider\c[0], a friend of Emilie. He greeted them to the mainland of CrossWorlds, also known as the \c[3]Croissant\c[0], and gave them a quick tour through the city. This quickly led to the \c[3]Seeker-HUB\c[0] which is where new players get an introduction into the background lore and main story of the game.

As explained by the \c[3]wise hologram\c[0], the players are on the planet \c[3]Shadoon\c[0] and supposed to follow the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0] as part of \c[3]Operation Trackwalker\c[0]. This means that they have to visit \c[3]various temples of the Ancients\c[0], earn the power of the \c[3]4 elements\c[0] and finally solve the mystery of the planet itself in a final challenge.

After receiving the permission to leave the town with the \c[3]Green Leaf Shade\c[0] and the option to consult the \c[3]very informative lore-texts\c[0] at any time, Lea and Emilie went outside to join up with Schneider again. The group then went to the exit of the town before Schneider had to leave the two rookies because of his guild-duties. Thus Emelie and Lea \c[3]formed a party\c[0] to take the first steps into CrossWorlds together.
Lea and Emilie were running through \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0] and had a lot of fun.

Lea is a girl who lost her memory due to unknown reasons. As if that wasn't enough she also lost the ability to speak thanks to a malfunction in her avatar's speech module. Determined to find out more about herself she agreed to play \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0].

Lea awakened on the \c[3]M.S. Solar\c[0], a cargo ship which belongs to the maintenance crew of CrossWorlds. There she met \c[3]Sergey\c[0] and \c[3]Carla\c[0] who helped her understand the situation. They taught her how to play the game and sent her to the mainland to regain her memory.

\c[3]Name\c[0]: Carla Salvatore
Carla is a mechanic on board the cargo ship \c[3]M.S. Solar\c[0] belonging to the maintenance crew of \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-worlds]\c[0]. She is a cheerful and open-minded person who likes to play around with new technology. Also kinda lazy.

Lea first met Carla shortly after awakening in the cargo hold of the M.S. Solar. Together with Sergey she helped Lea to understand the situation and introduced her to \v[lore.title.cross-worlds]. Carla also prepared the practice course to test Lea's abilities. She is highly valued by the ship's captain Jet despite her lack of discipline and indifference towards cleaning.
She helped \c[3]Captain Jet\c[0] preparing for the combat training with Lea. Later she aided Lea again to escape the cargo ship after the \c[3]\v[lore.title.designer]\c[0] appeared.

\c[3]Name\c[0]: Sergey Asimov
Sergey is a skilled software engineer with no apparent occupation other than helping Lea. He likes to be rational and tends to be specific on technical terms which might leave the impression and pragmatic personality.

He is the one brought Lea into the cargo hold of the \c[3]M.S. Solar\c[0]. Much like Carla he helps Lea to understand her predicament. He tells her that she lost her memory and that there might be a way to recover it by playing \v[lore.title.cross-worlds]. He started to solve the issue of Lea's broken Speech Module by adding certain words that she can use.
After arriving in \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0], beating her first dungeon and meeting her first Friend \c[3]Emilie\c[0], Sergey promised to gradually add more words to Leas vocabulary.

\c[3]Name\c[0]: Gerald "Jet" McFly
Jet is the captain of the cargo ship \c[3]M.S. Solar\c[0] belonging to the maintenance crew of \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-worlds]\c[0].
His stoic and tidy character makes him a respected man among his crew. His trusted Jetpack Betty, always at his side.

He is a close acquaintance to Carla and Sergej and provides his ship for Leas awakening. According to Carla he was once a famous \c[3]VRP Dueling Champion\c[0] in CrossWorlds. Despite his rough appearances he agrees to show Lea some tricks to help her survive in combat.

After the training was interrupted by the \c[3]\v[lore.title.designer]\c[0] Lea was taken hostage. While Lea was fighting against a \c[3]Huge Hostile Crab\c[0], Jet grabbed his \c[3]Solar Fist\c[0] to intervene. Thanks to him Lea was able to escape the ship unscathed.
As soon as Lea was off the ship, he used an \c[3]\v[lore.title.insta-matter-bomb]\c[0] to disrupt any traces of Instant Matter on the ship.

\c[3]Name\c[0]: ???
A mysterious blue avatar who appeared on the cargo ship \c[3]M.S. Solar\c[0]. He sees himself like some kind god and thus above all other beings. He seems to a special kind of avatar, being to fly and leave the \c[3]\v[lore.title.playground]\c[0].

After his arrival he mentions an irregularity on the ship and quickly points at Lea as the source. Noticing something strange about her, he grabs Lea using his abilities and throws her onto the cargo containers.
To test her "capabilities" he pitted her against a 
\c[3]Huge Hostile Crab\c[0] noting that she should be able to defeat it.

After the fight he seemed impressed with her abilities. As he was about to finally take Lea away \c[3]\v[lore.title.cap-jet]\c[0] intervened with the \c[3]\v[lore.title.solar-fist]\c[0]. While Lea was trying to escape to the teleporter he summoned powerful foes to catch her, but was unsuccessful in doing so.
Shortly after Lea escaped Captain Jet used an \c[3]\v[lore.title.insta-matter-bomb]\c[0] to disrupt any trace of \c[3]Instant Matter\c[0] on the cargo ship, thus getting rid of the Blue Avatar.

\c[3]Name\c[0]: Emilie-Sophie de Belmond
Emilie is a energetic young \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0] player who recently joined the game and seems to be quite enthusiastic about the game. She has a very competitive nature and wants to prove her skill wherever she can.

Lea first met Emilie before entering the \c[3]Rhombus Dungeon\c[0] and was quickly challenged to end of it. After beating Lea (being obviously exhausted) she befriended Lea on the spot. Without noticing Leas inability to speak, Emily dragged her along the introduction of CrossWorlds.

The two arrived at \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0] and met Emilie's friend \c[3]\v[lore.title.schneider]\c[0], a veteran player who gave them a tour of the city. Together they learned about \c[3]\v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker]\c[0].

\c[3]Name\c[0]: Lukas Fink
Schneider is a seasoned \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0] player who is friends with Emilie. Though he is very helpful he also enjoys teasing his friends. As a veteran in the game he knows almost every inch of it like his vest pocket.

Lea first met Schneider after arriving in Rookie Habor with Emilie. He showed them around and explained a few basic concepts of CrossWorlds. Before the group left the town, he himself had to leave for duties related to \c[3]his guild\c[0], though.

\c[3]Name\c[0]: ???
Apollo is a justice-driven player of \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0] who started around the same time as Lea and Emilie. His respect for the rules and disgust for cheaters are only matched by his outstanding sense of style.

Lea first met Apollo after clearing the \c[3]\v[area.rhombus-dng.name]\c[0] where he confronted her about alleged cheating. Though he was very adamant about bringing her to his own understanding of justice, the situation was quickly defused by his friend \c[3]Joern\c[0], who was clearly embarrassed by the whole scene.

\c[3]Name\c[0]: ???
Joern is laid-back player of \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0] and friend of \c[3]Apollo\c[0]. Though they seem to be very close to each other, Apollo's vigilante antics often tend to annoy Joern, who then apologizes to everyone involved before moving on.
Lea first met Joern after getting accused of cheating by Apollo. Joern apologized to Lea and Emily before leaving the scene of embarrassment.

A mysterious player who gives gifts to other players. There seems to be no logic to who gets a present, but some players you found mentioned receiving presents on multiple occasions. So the question is: Who is this man? And is his gifting power endless?

Shadoon is a planet located near a giant gas planet. It's home to the \c[3]Shad\c[0] and was once inhabitant by the \c[3]Ancients\c[0]. Most of the croissant shaped land is covered by marks of the \c[3]Track of the Ancient\c[0].

The Ancients are a name given to an archaic race who supposedly once lived on the plant of \c[3]\v[lore.title.planet]\c[0]. It is assumed that they left to other worlds a long time before the humans arrived for unknown reasons.
Remnants of their existence can be found in the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0] and various ruins all across the planet.

The Ancient seemed to have a special preference when it came to games. The track itself is the best evidence for it as it includes various tasks and puzzles to solve.
One might assume they got so advanced that the culture if the Ancients looked at the track the same way humans look at sport.

The Track of the Ancients is an over 1000 year old large-scale parkour game which played a large role in the \c[3]\v[lore.title.ancients]'s\c[0] Society. It is a self-sufficient system in which a contestant selects one of \c[3]5 Virtues\c[0] to collect 4 distinct \c[3]Elements\c[0] which will then be used to solve challenges of rising difficulty.

At first the human colonists were ignorant towards the Track when exploiting the planet for resources. Over time, though, it became apparent that it has some kind of mind or programming that uses it's capabilities to defend against perceived intruders. To prevent further conflict with native creatures and the land itself, \c[3]\v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker]\c[0] was conceived.

Operation Trackwalker was brought to life by the \c[3]\v[lore.title.human-government]\c[0] to study and solve the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0]. That way, it was hoped, it would be possible to control and finally use it to humanities advantage instead of simply trying to destroy it.

The project involves special trained humans, called \c[3]"\v[lore.title.seeker]s"\c[0], who are integrated into the Track. That way they can follow it and solve it's challenges in harmony with the rules specified by the \c[3]\v[lore.title.ancients]\c[0].

A \v[lore.title.seeker] is a human who has undergone special training and has been allowed access to the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0]. Once they choose one of the \c[3]5 Virtues\c[0], their goal is to master all 4 elements and use them in a final challenge to solve the mysteries behind the track.

Shad are the native people on \c[3]\v[lore.title.planet]\c[0]. They live in small tribe-like settlements all over the planet and keep a healthy relationship with the humans.
At first Shad where not fond of the humans as they tried to harvest ressources form the planet and in doing to destroyed ruins and the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0].

After the humans started \c[3]\v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker]\c[0] they become more friendly towards humans, so far to even provide resources for \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]s\c[0] on their path through the track.

Despite being native to the planet and having strong resemblance to images of the \c[3]\v[lore.title.ancients]\c[0], they posses no knowledge about the technology or any information regarding the track and its secrets.

The 5 Virtues mirror the foundation on which the Ancient's culture was build. Before a \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]\c[0] can begin the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0] he must choose a virtue which is connected to a \c[3]class\c[0]. 
- \c[3]Virtue of Strength\c[0]: Heat
- \c[3]Virtue of Endurance\c[0]: Cold
- \c[3]Virtue of Agility\c[0]: Shock
- \c[3]Virtue of Wisdom\c[0]: Wave
- \c[3]Virtue of Balance\c[0]: All
Each Virtue is also loosely connected to one of the \c[3]4 Elements\c[0] a Seeker can acquire on the Track.

Classes are what a \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]\c[0] chooses before entering the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0]. They are closely connected to the \c[3]\v[lore.title.virtues]\c[0] and shapes by which the \v[lore.title.ancients] lived by. These are they possible classes:
- \c[3]\v[lore.title.class-triblader]\c[0]: Virtue of Strength
- \c[3]\v[lore.title.class-quadroguard]\c[0]: Virtue of Endurance
- \c[3]\v[lore.title.class-pentafist]\c[0]: Virtue of Agility
- \c[3]\v[lore.title.class-hexacast]\c[0]: Virtue of Wisdom
- \c[3]\v[lore.title.class-spheromancer]\c[0]: Virtue of Balance
Each class gives the Seeker a unique way to master the \v[lore.title.track-of-ancients] the way they want to and give the special properties other classes don't provide.

Triblader follow the \c[3]Virtue of Strength\c[0]. Their focus is on powerful sword attacks. They lack in defense and ranged capabilities but make up for it by having increased strength.
The element usually associated with Tribladers is \c[3]Heat\c[0].

Quadroguards follow the \c[3]Virtue of Endurance\c[0]. They have a deficit in attack power and speed but have superior defense in comparison to all other classes. They can survive longer and can even take up multiple enemies at once with ease. 
Their element of choice is \c[3]Cold\c[0].

Pentafists follow the \c[3]Virtue of Endurance\c[0]. Speed and quick attacks with their fist are the main tools of a Pentafist player. However their HP is the lowest of all classes which basically makes them glass cannons.
Their favored element is \c[3]Shock\c[0].

Hexacast follow the \c[3]Virtue of Wisdom\c[0]. This class has the best ranged combat style. Using quick throws and powerful ranged \c[3]Arts\c[0] to fend of enemies. They lack critical attack power and fall short in HP to compensate for the benefits.
Hexacast primarily use the \c[3]Wave\c[0] Element.

Spheromancer follow the \c[3]Virtue of Balance\c[0]. They are a class of all trades, balancing each classes advantages and deficits to create well-versed fighter. Spheromancers became quiet rare since the class is not usually taken by a lot of players. Many consider the class as too weak or too challenging since players need to combine every tool in their arsenal to progress efficiently instead of having a clear focus.
Additionally Spheromancers don't favor any element and instead try to keep a balance between them.

Rhombus Square is the biggest city and capital of the human settlements on \c[3]\v[lore.title.planet]\c[0]. It is located in the sea near \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0] and constructed entirely out of glass and advanced metal alloys.
In order for a \c[3]Seeker\c[0] to gain access to the city, he must first collect two elements on the Track of the Ancients.

Among other things, the huge city contains the \c[3]\v[lore.title.newcomers-bridge]\c[0] and the headquarters of large institutions like the \c[3]\v[lore.title.human-government]\c[0], \c[3]\v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker]\c[0] and all the 4 big \c[3]\v[lore.title.factions]\c[0].

The Newcomer's Bridge is located in the skyline of \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0] and serves as the basic training for new \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]s\c[0]. Located near the end of the bridge is the \c[3]\v[area.rhombus-dng.name]\c[0] where the new recruits face their final test before taking the skyrails to \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-central]\c[0] and leaving for the mainland.
The Rookie Dungeon is located on \c[3]\v[lore.title.newcomers-bridge]\c[0] and serves as the final test for new \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]s\c[0].

Cross Central is the primary teleportation HUB for the human civilization on \c[3]\v[lore.title.planet]\c[0]. It is located on a large tower in the middle of \c[3]\v[area.rhombus-sqr.name]\c[0] and offers instant teleportation to all human settlements.

New \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]s\c[0] who just completed the training on \c[3]\v[lore.title.newcomers-bridge]\c[0] first enter Cross Central to teleport to \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0] and thus enter the main continent and start the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0].

Rookie Harbor is the first true human settlement on \c[3]\v[lore.title.planet]\c[0] and also serves as the beginning of every \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]'s\c[0] journey on the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0].
It was founded directly after human arrival on the planet, even before the construction of the current capital Rhombus Square was started. Located at the coast in the middle of the continent it is also the main trading and travelling hotspot to the mainland and often seen as the most comfortable human settlement.

On the landside it is surrounded by a temperate area full of apple trees that always seems to be stuck in the autumn season. Thus different colored apples and fishes from the sea are the main ingredients of most dishes in the settlement.
It was once called \c[3]Port Harbor\c[0], before \c[3]\v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker]\c[0] was conceived.

Autumn's Rise is a temperate area that seems to be in a state of permanent autumn. It's the first area a \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]\c[0] has to travel throw. The Fauna mainly consists out of \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]s\c[0] and \c[3]\v[combat.name.meerkat]s\c[0] but also contains some rather nasty \c[3]\v[combat.name.buffalo]s\c[0] to deal with.
Going off-path in Autumn's Rise might leads to interesting places such as the \c[3]Old Observatory\c[0] in the south-west of the area.

An old observatory located in \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0].
Inside the Observatory is not a telescope but what seems to be a fighting arena. The purpose of it is unclear but many theorize it was used as a training ground for new participants on the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0].
Leading to the jungle from Rookie Harbor.

Bergen Trail is a way up \c[3]Mount Bergen\c[0] from \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0], leading to \c[3]\v[area.bergen.name]\c[0].
At the foot of the mountain, the path begins with a green, temperate forest of coniferous hardwood trees, though it will inevitable start to snow when moving towards the top.

There are is home to a lot of \c[3]\v[combat.name.frobbit]s\c[0] who can hide below snow to attack with a surprise hit. You might also find some \c[3]\v[combat.name.penguin]s\c[0] along the way. 
Closer to Bergen you can also find \c[3]\v[combat.name.goat]s\c[0] and \c[3]\v[combat.name.snowman]s\c[0] which are tough foes if not prepared.

Bergen is a small, snowy village near the top of \c[3]Mount Bergen\c[0]. It was founded next to a \c[3]temple of the \v[lore.title.ancients]\c[0] to turn it into a mine and exploit the resources inside. The large building north of the village was once used as an INN but is not used as the majors building and greeting hall.
The Temple Mine is a Dungeon which holds the first element of the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0]: Heat.

Originally the Temple Mine was just a mine farmed by humans in order to acquire the precious ores and crystal inside. However the System of the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0] interrupted the destructive activities of the miners by taking over the robots used to dig tunnels and carry debris through small \c[3]\v[combat.name.mine-coldbug]\c[0].
Because of the vast destruction of the original temple the dungeon know looks like a mix both, thus the name.
Inside the area itself \c[3]Seekers\c[0] can find the \c[3]Heat\c[0] element by solving a series of puzzles.

Before it was decided to use \c[3]\v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker]\c[0] to find out more about the \c[3]Ancients\c[0] the \c[3]\v[lore.title.temple-mine]\c[0] was actually a mine farmed for it's precious resources.

The mine was eventually overrun by the Ancients system used to keep the Track of the Ancient intact. Vicious little bugs appeared and took over any mechanical system in the mine driving out the miners and leaving them without a job.

The \c[3]\v[lore.title.human-government]\c[0] is the governing entity on planet \c[3]Shadoon\c[0]. They use a counsel of 10 high ranking military and political individuals to administer resources and provide support for the 4 \c[3]Factions\c[0] as part of \c[3]Operation Trackwalker\c[0].

Guilds are organized companies of \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]s\c[0] who closely work together on a regular basis, even moreso than the usual groups of \v[lore.title.seeker]s.
Guilds often hand out tasks for other players to complete for them in order to further increase their reach.

Factions are groups of humans in \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-worlds]\c[0] who work to secure survival and further advancement of the humans on \c[3]\v[lore.title.planet]\c[0].
Most humans are part of one of 4 large factions with different fields of duties and core philosophies:
- \c[3]Venture Alliance (VA)\c[0]
- \c[3]Human Preservation Department (HPD)\c[0]
- \c[3]Association of Human Advancement (AHA)\c[0]
- \c[3]Amity of Balance (AoB)\c[0]

While the facitons are filled with highly resourceful experts of their field, they often need the support of the \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]\c[0] because of their special connection to the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0].

The Venture Alliance is a faction mainly responsible for doing pioneer work by exploring and claiming new land, hunting and scavenging wildlife and mining natural ressources. Thus it often attracts a individualistic, adventuring type of people who prefer active work in the field, even if it's dangerous.
(They have also been involved in early field tests with \c[3]\v[lore.title.operation-trackwalker]\c[0]?)
The subfaction of the \c[3]Venture Alliance\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0].
The Human Preservation Department is a faction mainly responsible for the protection and discipline of the human settlements on \v[lore.title.planet]

The subfaction of the \c[3]Human Preservation Department\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0].

They are tasked to keep justice and order in \v[area.rookie-harbor.name] and the surrounding areas like \v[area.autumn-area.name]. This includes both defending against attacks from the track and solving crimes done by other humans.
The Association of Human Advancement is a faction mainly responsible for trade, manufacturing and scientific research.

Subfactions include:
- \c[3]Rookie Fishermen & Trading Cooperation (RFTG)\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0]
The subfaction of the \c[3]Association of Human Advancement\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0].

The Amity of Balance is a faction mainly responsible for farming, gathering and research of the local fauna and gaining an understanding of the inner workings of the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0].
The subfaction of the \c[3]Amity of Balance\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0].

\c[3]Omni Gilders\c[0] is the name of a guild in CrossWorlds. As one of the largest guilds it has multiple bases in various towns and villages. Their main goal is to become a large trading guild which helps low lever players with fetch quests and uses the income to build more bases.

CrossWorlds is a Massive Multiplayer Online Game made by \c[3]\v[lore.title.dev-company]\c[0]. It features a unique setting on an actual planet called \c[3]\v[lore.title.real-planet]\c[0] owned and terra-formed by the developers.

Players make use of the \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-gear]\c[0] to connect to special Avatars made out of \v[lore.title.instant-matter]. The goal of the game is to beat the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0], a set of open areas and dungeons players have to overcome in order to get to the end.
The Playground is the official location where \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-worlds]\c[0] takes place. It is often called "The Croissant" by players because of it's form.

The Players in \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0] are actually real human players, playing the game. They control temporary physical bodies, called \c[3]\v[lore.title.avatars]\c[0], that entirely consist of a formable material called \c[3]\v[lore.title.instant-matter]\c[0]. In the game they play as a \c[3]\v[lore.title.seeker]\c[0] who tries to solve the \c[3]\v[lore.title.track-of-ancients]\c[0].

VRP, short for Virtual Ricochet Projectile, are, as the name suggests, projectiles used as an offensive weapon in the world of \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0]. 
Unlike the Avatars themselves, VRP are not made of \c[3]Instant Matter\c[0], but are virtual projections interacting with the game world. This means that people like the \c[3]Maintenance Crew\c[0] are not able to see them unless they wear special goggles.

Since the term "Virtual Ricochet Projectile" is quite long, players started calling them simply "Balls". Obviously jokes started to appear and quickly spiraled out of control.
Over time however making jokes became unpopular and nowadays even hinting at such a joke earns one disrespect of most players.

Instatainment is a galaxy wide company focused on providing entertainment via \c[3]Instant Matter\c[0] technology. One of their biggest products is \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0], a Massive Multiplayer Online Game which takes place on an actual planet in the galaxy.
Avatars are humanoid bodies made of \c[3]\v[lore.title.instant-matter]\c[0] that are controlled by human players of \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-worlds]\c[0].
The Milky Way Galaxy is the home of the human race. At this point about half of the space has been explored and numerous colonies have been established.
Thanks to \c[3]\v[lore.title.com-tech]\c[0] communication between colonies and travel is almost instant, making the galaxy itself the home of the humans.
\c[3]Trivia\c[0]: To this date no other sentient life has been found in the galaxy. Only hospitable planets and animals.

Raritan Gem is the name given to the planet on which \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0] was built. Not the be confused with the "in-game" name of the planet which is \c[3]Shadoon\c[0].
The diameter of the planet is roughly 12.000 km and it's mostly covered by water with only one large patch of landmass. Researchers assume that the planet once had more landmass and some event led to the oceans rising.
Despite the planet's orbit around a gas giant, its unique position in its solar system makes the air breathable and the temperature consistent enough to be hospitable.

Point Origin refers to solar system in the \c[3]\v[lore.title.milky-way]\c[0]. Not much is known about the system as most records are either lost or obscured by historians. Many times have humans tried to locate the system. So often that it became a whole science.

While some believe the system is not real or surrounded by hazards like black holes, others believe Point Origin to be a symbol for their own Religion. 
However why people are so obsessed with finding Point Origin is a question no one can answer.

Instant Matter is a low-density material that can easily be created and formed by a remote system. It serves as core component of \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-worlds]\c[0] because all non-static entities, like \c[3]Player-\v[lore.title.avatars]\c[0], \c[3]Enemies\c[0] and \c[3]Non-Player Characters\c[0] are created from it.

Objects made out of Instant Matter can barely have any effect on real objects of solid mass, because they are too light and unstable to actually apply noticeable force. 
In the same sense, while they can be easily destroyed by physical force, structures of Instant Matter can be reformed just as quickly as long as the connection to the remote system persist.

This device is used to connect a human to the world of \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-worlds]\c[0]. Through the \c[3]\v[lore.title.com-tech]\c[0] it is possible to control the character in-game with absolutely zero lag, resulting in great immersion as all senses are tightly connected to the device and thus the game too.
However the technology used for the gear is still experimental and as such still has issues. A prominent example is the \c[3]Speech Desynchronisation\c[0] which happens because of interference between the gear and the \c[3]\v[lore.title.avatars]\c[0] in CrossWorlds.

The Direct Link is a messaging system used to talk privately to players in your contact list. To contact a person, you just need to open the social menu and select the player you want to talk to. If the player is not online, you can leave a message. The system works via voice only. This means there is actually no way to message another player via "typing text" in \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0].

According to \c[3]\v[lore.title.dev-company]\c[0], the developers of CrossWorlds, this was done to increase the immersion. However, some players argue that it makes talking to friends occasionally difficult since the \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-gear]\c[0] is known to sometimes have issues with voice synchronization.

A bazooka-like weapon used by \c[3]\v[lore.title.cap-jet]\c[0] to prevent \v[lore.title.designer] from taking Lea. 
It seems to be capable to disrupt \c[3]\v[lore.title.instant-matter]\c[0] temporarily.

The "Instant Matter Field Neutralizer" is a bomb used on the \c[3]M.S. Solar\c[0] by \c[3]\v[lore.title.cap-jet]\c[0] to "make sure that no traces of \c[3]CrossWorlds\c[0] are left on the ship", as Jet put it.
While it has no apparent effect on solid matter or organic lifeforms, it seems to completely disrupt and thus destry anything made from \c[3]\v[lore.title.instant-matter]\c[0] within it's range.

The cargo ship of \c[3]\v[lore.title.cap-jet]\c[0], which served as a training area for \c[3]Lea\c[0] before entering \c[3]\v[lore.title.cross-worlds]\c[0] for real. It's main task is shipping maintenance parts and personal to the \c[3]\v[lore.title.playground]\c[0] to keep the real world technology of the game intact.
The ship is powered by solar energy, which is why it has huge solar panels on deck.
One of the Cargo Crew members has a quest for you! And it involves hitting things! Straightforward, isn't it?
The crew member watched you with joy as you pummeled those enemies.
Talk to the Crew member in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0] again
One of the Cargo Crew members has another quest and this time you have to collect things. By hitting plants!
The crew member happily received the items you found.
Collect the items by destroying plants
Talk to the Crew member in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0] again
Captain Jet, asked you to find to find two key pieces hidden in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0]. Find them and find out what's inside the observatory.
You found the two pieces! Now it is time to check out whats inside that Observatory.
Bring the Pieces back to the Captain at the \c[3]Old Observatory\c[0]
A game tester near the end of \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0] has asked you to take part in a game test. Help him verify this parkour course. However if you leave the map, your progress is lost!
The tester seemed pretty satisfied with your performance. He even told you that you can help him in the future! You can decide if that is a good thing or not.
Test out the Parkour by stepping on the first marker in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0]
A scared player asked you to investigate on the matter of the vicious creature that attack her. Find out more about this "bunny" and how exact your revenge on it.
You have captured the legendary bunny and brought it back to the scared player. Turns out the bunny was just a regular \c[3]\v[combat.name.gray-frobbit]\c[0]. At least you got some reward, right?
Ask the friends about the \c[3]Legendary Bunny\c[0]
Triblader at the Obeslik in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0]
Return to the scared player in \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0]
Return to the \c[3]Jean\c[0] in \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0] again
Capture \c[3]Legendary Bunny\c[0] in \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0] by defeating it

\c[3]Holiday Man\c[0] who apparently likes to gift people for fun, asked you to help him giving presents to various players. Bring the presents to the players!
You helped \c[3]Holiday Man\c[0] giving a out the presents in time. He gave you his special hat, revealing his true form to you. You were blinded by light.
Go back to \c[3]Holiday Man\c[0] in \c[3]\v[area.bergen-trails.name]\c[0] again
A rather eccentric person in Bergen wants you help in search for a Tophat worthy of his refined taste. Find a suitable artisan who can help you with that task!
You haven't been able to satisfy the guy's wishes, but you did what you could. Maybe you can help him again later?
Gather materials for a presentable tophat!
Bring the material to the hatmaker.
Bring the \v[item.161.name] to the fashion dude
One of the generals of the \c[3]Omni Gilders\c[0] Guild has asked to obtain some materials for their base. You can find them in the \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0] and on \c[3]Bergen Trails\c[0].
You found the requested materials for the general. Return to him and check if he has more quests for you.
Find the items in the \c[3]Temple Mine\c[0] and on \c[3]Bergen Trails\c[0]
D'Kar asks you again to help him find a special item. Maybe finding this item will help to understand his multi-class attire!
You brough D'Kar the Broken Shield, but the only thing you got this time is a rather stupid joke.

She got the mail. And seems very happy about it.

A Man in \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0] challenged you to beat his challenge. Go ride those railings and show him what you got!

Businesspeople are in danger of doing business without eating! Search for the \c[3]food collector in \v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0]  and find out what happened to her and the delivery.

Dr. Nina Niquowich needs some needles necessary for her alternative medicine. Apparently Hedgehags are a source for such high-grade instruments.
Pioneer Tucos of the Falldivers has lost a \c[3]data storage\c[0] while fleeing from agressive wildlife. Use your \c[3]Analysis\c[0] to find it and retrieve it.
You found the data, brought it back and whooped some naughty Meerkats as a bonus.
Find and examine the location of the data on \c[3]Off Road 1\c[0] of \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0]
You talked with the captain of the \c[3]Rookie Harbor Guard\c[0] and decided to help them out a bit. One of the city guards \c[3]needs some reinforcements\c[0].
You were finally able to catch the elusive thief after rescuing him from the wildlife. Hopefully he learnt his lesson by now.

Come to me, my noble hornybuns!

We are but trapped in a nightmare, awaiting the final call.

I... I don't know what to say.
Thank you so much. I've never get anything from anyone.
A yellow triangle. Seems to be rather useless.
A simple lunch for travels. Heals 15% of max HP.
A tad bitter but incredibly heartwarming nonetheless.
Sweet and fruity tea. Keeps you warm for a long time.
Heros where once using this device to captured legendary fiends.
Is fabled to be the bane of many a conqueror.
An extremely rare weapon created by a paramilitary organization of unknown origin.

Once used to banish a demonic invasion.

Transforms the wearer into an extraordinary Musician.

Soft armor infused with the lifeforce of headstrong bovines.
Piercing weapon that is low in power but offers a surprisingly deadly potential.
Crude and cumbersome weapon for long-ranged confrontations.

Comfortable sandals which offer little protection but grant a liberating feeling.

Revitalizing garment of living material. It's gnawed on one side.

A cracker made of rice. It's a bit salty.
Perfect with a tiny bit of soy milk.

Prepare for mild to severe discomfort.
A rare type of tomato salad seasoned with some ginger and salt.
Perfect to shortly keep you warm on a cold winter night.

Various metal parts. Might look old but could be used to create new equipment.

This where you can take a look at all your collected items or set certain consumables as your favorites.
Use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right] to cycle through the categories or press on the tabs if you use the mouse.
The first tab shows the last items you have collect to keep an eye on all your loot!
Pressing \i[help3] opens the sort menu. You can choose between 4 types of sorting:
--\c[3]Auto\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by a natural order.
--\c[3]Name\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the name of the items.
--\c[3]Amount\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the amount of each item you have. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same amount.
--\c[3]Rarity\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the rarity of each item. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same rarity.

Most consumables are \c[3]buffs used to aid you in battle\c[0]. Hovering over an consumable that is also a buff shows a little interface telling you what the items does in the \c[3]bottom left corner\c[0].
The symbols you see tell you what stat or modifier changes and how strong the stat is increased. Scroll right to get a list describing each symbol.
--\i[stat-rank-1]:-- Marks a slight increase in the given stat or modifier.
--\i[stat-rank-2]:-- Marks a medium increase in the given stat or modifier.
--\i[stat-rank-3]:-- Marks a large increase in the given stat or modifier.
--\i[stat-heat]:-- Increases resistance against the heat element.
--\i[stat-cold]:-- Increases resistance against the cold element.
--\i[stat-shock]:-- Increases resistance against the shock element.
--\i[stat-wave]:-- Increases resistance against the wave element.
Hover over an item in the Consumables Section and press \i[help2] to add it as a favorite
In this menu you can equip your collected gear into 5 different slots.
Select a body part by clicking on one of the buttons. You can also use the mouse to click on the buttons in the center.
Additionally you can cycle through the body parts using \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] or \i[left] and \i[right].
Pressing \i[help3] opens the sort menu. You can choose between 8 types of sorting:
--\c[3]Auto\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by a natural order.
--\c[3]Name\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the name of the items.
--\c[3]Amount\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the amount of each item you have. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same amount.
--\c[3]Rarity\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the rarity of each item. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same rarity.
--\c[3]HP\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the hp stat of each item. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same hp value.
--\c[3]Attack\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the attack stat of each item. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same attack value.
--\c[3]Defense\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the defense stat of each item. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same defense value.
--\c[3]Focus\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the focus stat of each item. Reverts back to \c[3]Auto\c[0] if 2 items have the same focus value.

Hovering over a piece of equipment shows the changes on your \c[3]status parameters\c[0] on the left side of the screen. Having already equipped an item will show how your parameters change when switching to another piece of gear.
\c[3]Modifiers\c[0] are shown below the status parameters. Scroll right to get list of the effects each modifier can have.
--\c[3]XP Zero\c[0]: Don't gain any experience by defeating enemies.
--\c[3]Trainer\c[0]: Increases the amount of experience you get from defeating enemies.
--\c[3]Lucky Lucky\c[0]: Increases the chance to get items from enemies.
--\c[3]Scope\c[0]: Increases the speed of getting precise aiming.
--\c[3]Shooter\c[0]: Increases the damage of ranged attacks.
--\c[3]Brawler\c[0]: Increases the damage of melee attacks.
--\c[3]Bullseye\c[0]: Increases the damage of critical attacks.
--\c[3]Assault\c[0]: Adding chance to fire projectiles during melee.
--\c[3]Heavy Calibre\c[0]: Increases knockback from charged shots.
--\c[3]Flash Step\c[0]: Increase the time of invincibility when dashing.
--\c[3]Iron Stance\c[0]: Increase your knockback resistance to weak attacks, depending on MaxHP.
--\c[3]HP Regen\c[0]: Activates HP regeneration while in combat, depending on MaxHP.
In this menu you can spend your collected \c[3]Cross Points (CP)\c[0] to unlock skills on the skill trees.
For this demo you can only select the neutral skill tree in the center of the screen. The final version will feature a tree for each element.
Scroll right to get more info on the detailed view that appears once you press on one of the trees.
Use \i[key-up]\i[key-left]\i[key-down]\i[key-right] or drag the mouse to move around the skill tree.
With the gamepad you can use \i[left-stick] to move the cursor around and \i[right-stick] to just move the camera.
Hover over a skill to see what it does and how many CP you need to activate it.
Note that in order to activate a skill you must first unlock its parent.
Notice the branches on some paths along the skill tree? Those always offer 2 ways and you can only walk on one of them.
However you can \c[3]switch between both paths at any time without spending any additional points\c[0] as long as you have a skill activated on one of the branch paths.
By pressing \i[help2] you can enter a special swap mode in the overview where you can quickly swap branches. Just select a panel and press it to swap the skills!
The aforementioned branches always contain at least one \c[3]Combat Art\c[0] on each way, which you can recognize by their \c[3]light-grey background\c[0].
Those Combat Arts are skills that don't increase your parameters but instead allow you to perform special abilities during combat, in exchange for \c[3]Special Points (SP)\c[0].
Combat Arts can greatly increase your chances in battle, so it is advised that you learn at least one of them as quickly as possible!
Here you can check out your current position, see how many treasures you have found or the the teleport system
Use \i[key-up]\i[key-left]\i[key-down]\i[key-right] to move the camera or drag with the mouse. You can also use \i[left-stick] to move or \i[right-stick] to pan the camera with the gamepad.
Pressing \i[help3] centers the current floor. If Lea is on the currently active floor it will center on the room she is currently in.
Once a \c[3]Landmark\c[0] is activated it can be selected by hovering over the symbol \i[landmark] with the mouse or the gamepad cursor.
Clicking or pressing \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad opens a confirmation dialog.
Selection yes closes the menu and teleports Lea to the location of the landmark
Pressing \i[help2] opens or closes the worldmap of CrossWorlds. In this menu you can select an area you have already visited.
Hovering over an area reveals a the name and a short description of the area.
Clicking or pressing \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad displays the maps of the area. Here you can use the teleport system to warp you to landmarks you activated in the selected area.
In this menu you can change various settings to customize your game experience. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the tabs.
Some options might require a restart. Options like these are \c[3]marked with a red information text.\c[0]
Options are saved as soon as you leave the main menu.
Use \i[help2] to reset all settings back to default. This will also reset all your key bindings.
This menu features a wide array of information about all your quests, stats and achievements!
Right now however, you can only selects \c[3]Quests\c[0].
On the left side you can a see a quick summary including your \c[3]current task\c[0] and your \c[3]active quest\c[0].
In this menu you can watch all your active and finished quests.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Selecting a quest shows you a quick summary including the latest fulfilled tasks and description.
Pressing on a quest opens the \c[3]Detail View\c[0]. This menu gives you a more precise look at a quest.
To quickly cycle through the quests in detail view use \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Pressing \i[help3] opens the sort menu. You can choose between 4 types of sorting:
--\c[3]Date\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the time you accepted the quest. Newest ones first.
--\c[3]Auto\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by a natural order.
--\c[3]Name\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the name of the quests.
--\c[3]Level\c[0]:-- Sorts the list by the level of each quest. Reverts back to \c[3]Date\c[0] if 2 quests have the same level.
Pressing \i[help2] while hovering over a quest in the active section marks it as favorite quests. Pressing \i[help2] on a marked quest un-favorites it.
Favorite quests are highlighted outside the menu in the top-right corner of the screen.
You can change between them outside the menu by using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right] on the keyboard or by pressing \i[left-stick] and \i[right-stick] on the gamepad.
This makes for an easy to way to highlight the quest you want to solve most.

Hover over a quest in the Active Quest Section and press \i[help2] to set it as a favorite! 

Do the same on a faved quest to un-favorite it.
In this menu you can buy consumables or equipment.
Note that you need to have sufficient funds to buy an item!
In this menu you can save your progress and see all the save files you have created.
Scroll through the save slots using \i[mousewheel] with the mouse or the direction buttons on the gamepad.
Click on a slot or press \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad to save the game on the selected slot.
Press \i[help3] to create \c[3]a new save file\c[0] or \i[help2] to \c[3]delte a save file\c[0] by hovering over a slot.
You can also use the first entry in the list to create a new save file.
The list automatically sorts the latest saves on top of the list.
When overriding a save file, the selected slot will automatically move on op of the list. Or better below the \c[3]Create new save file slot\c[0]
The same is true for newly create save files of course!
A single save file display some basic information about you progress:
--\c[3]Chapter\c[0]:-- Reflects your story progress via the chapter you are in and a small graphic.
--\c[3]Level\c[0]:-- The level you have on this save file.
--\c[3]Location\c[0]:-- The area and map you saved in.
--\c[3]Version\c[0]:-- Display next to Leas head. Reflects the version of the save file in contrast to the current game version.
--\c[3]Playtime\c[0]:-- The play time of this save file.
In this menu you can load a save file and start where you left.
Scroll through the save slots using \i[mousewheel] with the mouse or the direction buttons on the gamepad.
Click on a slot or press \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad to load the save file on the selected slot.
Press \i[help2] to \c[3] delete a save file\c[0] by hovering over a slot.
In this menu you can read about all the interesting topics you come across while exploring CrossWorlds.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Select an entry to reveal the first page of the entry if it is unlocked.
To switch between pages, use \i[page-left] or \i[page-right].
There are multiple ways to unlock lore entries. You can either just talk to people or find more information about a topic by progressing the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0].
I added some extra code here for you, Lea. Next to the in-game categories I added one for your progress, one for characters and one for your memories.
I will insert those entries for you when they come along!
In this menu you can find detailed information about every enemy you encounter.
Cycle through the tabs using \i[circle-left] and \i[circle-right].
Select an entry to reveal the first page of the enemy and use \i[page-left] or \i[page-right] to switch pages.
In order to unlock the second page of enemy, you need to \c[3]defeat it at least 10 times\c[0].
Reports are unlocked by first defeating an enemy at least 10 times.
They show useful information or trivia about the selected enemy.
This first page, including the species of the enemy, will always be unlocked.
Additional reports are unlocked through various tasks, such as defeating even more of enemy, solving quest, progressing the story and so on.
In this menu you can invite/remove other player into your party or contact them.
Hover over a contact to get a closer look at the stats and equipment of the player.
Click on a slot or press \i[gamepad-a] on the gamepad to invite/remove the player.
This way you can also contact the player. Note that some players might not answer if their not online

This menu is a compilation of all your progress in numbers. Use \i[circle-right] and \i[circle-left] to navigate through the categories. To scroll through a category use the mouse wheel or \i[down] and \i[up].

Sadly, we can't just give you the stuff.\. There's rules y'know?
Don't worry, we'll just turn it into a reward for a simple quest.
Alright! Come back to me when you defeated the hedgehogs.
Oh, okay! No Problem Ms. Avatar. Please come back if you changed your mind.
Hello Ms Avatar!\. Enjoying the game?
Of course you do!\. Man, I wish I had a VRP-device to go with my glasses.
Oh well, back to work.\. Looks like you still need to defeat \c[3]\v[quest.my-first-quest.subrequire.0] hedgehogs\c[0].
Wow Ms Avatar, you really did it! Here's your rewards for it!
Hello Ms Avatar, ready for another quest to get the rest of the equipment?
Happy collecting and remember that different plants yield different items!
Oh, okay! No Problem Ms. Avatar. Please come back if you changed your mind.
Hello Ms Avatar!\. Enjoying the game?
Of course you do!\. Man, I wish I had a VRP-device to go with my glasses.
Oh well, back to work.\. Looks like you still need to collect \c[3]\v[quest.my-first-quest_2.subrequire.0] Autumn Leaves\c[0] and \c[3]\v[quest.my-first-quest_2.subrequire.1] Golden Beetles\c[0].
Wow Ms Avatar, you really did it! Here's your rewards for it!
Sorry Ms Avatar, I'm on vacation now.\. Everything's so amazing!
How to increase the \c[3]Combat Rank\c[0] to improve drops of defeated enemies.
Your \c[3]combat rank\c[0] is displayed in the upper right corner during combat.
By \c[3]defeating enemies\c[0] your rank will increase.
With a higher combat rank, enemies will \c[3]drop more items\c[0], including \c[3]special rare items\c[0].
When you're out of combat you'll enter the \c[3]cooldown phase\c[3].
When the blue line disappears, combat will end and you will  \c[3]lose your rank\c[0].
However, when you enter combat during cool down, you \c[3]keep your combat rank\c[3]!
Time to meet our pet again!
This time, we prepared a stage for you.
We took the liberty to change it.
Now show us your best performance!

text.en_US: Home to all guilds with small budgets!
Hello, and welcome to the First Scholar's headquarter!

The Hedgehog Sandwich
- Myth or Fiction -
The Art of the Laser Lasagne
I came to see this darn old excuse for an observatory.
To think of what has become of this place...
Ye see, in my time this place had a some nasty foes in it.
'Tis was a good place for a good brawl.
There is a note on the door however.
"I took the key and broke it into 2 pieces. I hid them in this area. You can try to find them, but I'm sure you never will!"
Seems like some bugger had fun here.
What a preposterous reason for a quest...
Well, I guess the solution is simple.
Ye lass go and find me the pieces.
I'm no avatar so I can't see those darn chests. But you can.
Ah, this is what I like to see.
Talk to me again if ye found all the pieces.
Ye come back to me when ye ready, aye?
Talk to me again if ye found all the pieces.
Ye come back to me when ye ready, aye?
Ye found all the pieces yet?
Ye found all the pieces yet?
Ye makin an old man proud, lass.
Here, take this for your trouble.
And Ye talk to me as soon as you ready to try this out.
Now let's see if this works.
Glad to see this's not some lazy prank.
Alright. Ye go ahead and see if there still foes to find in there.
It's alright. Not like I can do much damage to them.
Ye go on ahead and see if there still foes to find in there.
Looks like you helped the captain to finally open that strange building.
Oh, you're that girl from the cargo ship?
The captain got some weird call from the developers. He's over there.
Why don't you pay him a visit?
This old geezer simply won't go away...
Amazing. Now he stole the quest...
Don't tell me you finished the quest?
Really? I was waiting all day for a chance.
I didn't mention it before but I also setup shop!
Just talk to me if you need something!
What can I hook you up with?
You sure you wanna reset all your skills?
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
You want to give this to me?
That's awfully nice of you. May I ask why?
Wait what? Please tell me your voice module is broken.
Phew, well no problem. It can happen.
Ye just go into that big room to start the fight.
I will save the time ye take for it.
Ye just go into that big room to start the fight.
I will save the time ye take for it.
Ye back for another try or to see your best time?
Ye just go into the big room lass. I'll save the time for ye.
Ye wanna take a look at your best times?
Alright. Ye come back later then. The challenge takes a some time to be ready again.
Still big room inside a darn small building.
Them developers sure know to make it look plausible.
Well, the counter is still there. So I guess you can take on the challenge.
Ye want to try it out?
But ye better make sure ye're up to the task.
The challenge here is pretty darn tough.
He, can't stop the lass from a fight.
Ye just go into that big room to start the battle.
I will save the time ye need for it.

text.en_US: Ye did it! Very good performance, lass.
As promised I saved your time. So ye' just talk to me to get an overview.
However the challenge will need some time to be ready again.
Let me guess, I'm not your first right?
I'm not sure why, but someone just sends me gifts from times to times.
Well, I don't mind the free stuff, so keep them coming.
A Spheromancer? Not something I see often these days.
You see the class is very hard to master so it became a bit unpopular I would say.
So today, you find only a handful of people trying to play this class.

\i[arrow-n] ???.
\i[arrow-w] Road to Bergen Trail
\i[arrow-e] Rookie Harbor
I... I am so sorry.\. For real this time.
I am serious!\. I am out of smokebombs anyway, otherwise those damn \v[combat.name.hedgehog]s never would've gotten me.
But maybe they've been sent by the Track to show me the errors of my way.
This time I will turn myself in and atone for my crimes. Truly.
So... if you will excuse me.
Yes, you wanna come with me.
B... but I was going to come to you anyway.\. Don't you trust me?
Sorry pal. Trust is nice and all but I won't take any more risks with you.
In any case, thanks girl.\. You did great work here.\. Report back to the chief to get your reward.

Can't you see I'm in a middle of something here?
Still in a middle of something.
Oh dang it, I fell asleep again.
Sorry for startling you. Is this for me?
Mon dieu, not that guy again~
Good!\. I see your level is now in an acceptable range.
As if that one level would have made a big difference.
Your previous actions have not been forgotten!
Being a cheater is bad as it is.
But seeing a \c[3]Spheromancer\c[0] displaying such dishonest behavior!\. It aches my heart!
We Spheromancer are a noble, yet unappreciated class!
I can't allow a player like you to further damage our reputation!
Why of course!\. Don't you see my striking crimson outfit?
Pardon, I thought you were a Triblader with all that green and...\. pointy hair.
It's plain to see that fashion is beyond your grasp.
Anyway!\. I'm talking to you, blue haired Spheromancer!
Come on!\. We just started playing!
Of course we won't do it right here and now.
Let's have the duel at the \c[3]entrance of Bergen Trail\c[0]!
I'll test your skills properly - to make sure you don't use any more dishonest methods!
Do you accept, blue haired Spheromancer?
Good!\. I'll be waiting for you!
Are you sure it's ok to accept his challenge just like that?
Then let's make sure you're well prepared!
I want you to kick this guy's derrière!

We were tasked to be here by powers beyond even ours.
We prepared another challenge for you.
Ha! We knew you can't resist our endeavor.
But don't think our offer comes without a price.
Find 20 chests in this area and we will give you what you want.
What's this? You already found them all?
Well, I expected no less from this vessel.
Talk to us whenever you are ready.
I see you still missing some chests.
We see you found all those treasures.
So tell us then. Are you ready for a challenge?
You returned. Are you ready for a challenge?
Oh, we will measure the time you take.
As we offer this endeavor more than once.
We will give you the chance to compare you fastest times.
What? You think you can't handle our quest?
Oh? Are you up for another fight?
As promised we will offer our challenge again.
You can also take a look at you fastest times.
We like to hear this. Off we go!
Interested in your best time I reckon?
Fine. We will wait until you changed your tiny mind.
We don't like it but we are forced to give you this.
Don't expect a second reward from us.

text.en_US: Halfway through! I'll go to the end and wait for you.
I'm a one of the testers for this game!
The devs asked me to test a almost finished new quest type: \c[3]Parkours\c[0]!
I'm kinda tired and you just came along. So\..\..\.. Wanna try it out?
Nice! Good to see some enthusiasm!
Alright, get this. You will start right next to me.
When you touch this checkpoint, another will pop up.
Your goal is to walk though every marker until you hit the last one.
Aaaaand the last one is over there.
It will only appear after you hit last normal marker.
Yeah, I know. But it's more fun that way right?
Well, at least if you like running.
Also, if you leave the map all your progress is lost!
Awesome! As said, just start by stepping on the first marker here!
Really? Oh man, I don't wanna do this all alone.
If you ever change your mind...
Just one more, it's right next to you!
Go on, you can do it!
Just step on this first marker here and start running!
Just one more, it's right next to you!
Go on, you can do it!
Just step on this first marker here and start running!
At there was no problem, right? No sudden shocks or anything?
Thanks a lot! Take this for your efforts.
I hope we can meet again.
...So you can help me again, you know?
One of the sick trees. Apply \c[3]\v[item.171.name]\c[0] to cure it.
Hello. I am the canonical NPC.

\i[arrow-w] To Bergen Trail
\i[arrow-ne] To Rookie Harbor
\i[arrow-s] Old Path
Sorry, I'm kinda in the middle of something here...
Oh wait. You're that girl\..\..\.. Lea, right?
Jean already told me you'd come.
Sorry to get you involved. I can't understand why she's not using the Direct Link.
This is about the bunny or whatever she saw right?
I do remember that you can summon some sort of \c[3]Legendary Bunny\c[0] by collecting 5 \c[3]\v[item.139.name]s\c[0] somewhere in \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0].
But there was another requirement. I can't remember what it was. Maybe our Hexacast-friend Jock knows more about.
Yepp, that's all. Also, I'm \c[3]Jeff\c[0], nice to meet you.
Ah there's the problem with the speech module Jean told me about.
Nah, don't sweat it. I just DL Jean everything I told you.
She should learn how to use the Direct Link System anyway.
I DL Jean everything, so you don't have to tell her.
We're clearly missing some item here.
They do that to promote going back to areas.
I bet the content is totally worth it.

text.en_US:
\i[arrow-nw] To Bergen Trail.
\i[arrow-ne] To Rookie Harbor
\i[arrow-sw] Ye old Observatory
Hm, I hope we don't get lost around here.
Seems we have to head \c[3]north west\c[0] to reach Bergen Trail.
I hope it's not too far.
I will have to logout sooner or later, you see?
Oh, don't worry. I'll stay until you beat up Mr. Fancypants!
And please don't hurry too much because of me!
We have to make sure you're well trained, non?
We've been playing for a long while now, Lea.
Anyway, I suppose there is still time for you to face that duel.

Waaah...!
Don't be so loud, do you want THEM to hear you?
I'm talking about those thieving Bovines!\. They've ambushed me and stole all that fruits and herbs I've been gathering!
Look at that beast, grazing there like nothing happened!\. And there's more of them in the bushes, just waiting for a victim!
But... you were sent to help me, right?\. I worked all day collecting that stuff, we need to get it back!
Well...\. you have to do it.\. I have to...\. watch for reinforcements.\. So...\. good luck!
Go slaughter them and bring me the package!\. I'll be right here, surveying the situation!
Great work!\. Now... please bring me the package?\. I don't trust this silence.
There they are, the fruits of my labor!\. Literally.
Thanks a bunch!\. You totally saved my butt here!\. But now I gotta get going and deliver those before it's too late.\. So...\. bye!
Sorry I can't muster more feeling, But I get these things way too often.
I don't get it. How does a stranger know what I wanted?
I don't know why you give me these but you gotta stop.
Did you notice how they removed the meeting place here?
Yeah, Patch notes said it's for some bigger update soon.
Are you...\. a new player, too?
Great! ...\. I mean uh...\. Could you help me with something?
See...\. I need new equipment...\. An \c[3]Iron Mail\c[0].
I heard they offer it in the armory of R-\.\c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0]...\.once you reach this place.
I'd buy it myself...\. but...\. see...
I hate this town!\. It's so crowded!\. So many people, signs and noises!\. I-\.I can't take it...
So uh...\. Could you please buy some \c[3]Iron Mail\c[0] for me at Rookie Harbor?
O-\.Of course I'll pay you back...\. So...\. uhm...\. pretty please?
P-\.Please buy me that \c[3]Iron Mail\c[0] from the armory in Rookie Harbor.
They should offer it n-\.now that you've reached Bergen Trail.
...Oh!\. I-\.Is that the \c[3]Iron Mail\c[0] you bought for me?
Here I'll pay you back the price!\. P-\.Plus some extra!
A-\.And also some items I found in Bergen Trail!\. It's not much, but maybe you can use it...
I g-\.gotta go now!\. Thanks again!
I didn't mention it before but I also setup shop!
Just talk to me if you need something!
What can I hook you up with?
You sure you wanna reset all your skills?
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
No problem! Come back if you changed you mind.
W... W... Welcome to Bergen Trail!
Puh... Apologies my lady. I just came down from \c[3]Bergen\c[0].
They say: "Down is the easy way".
At my age, both ways are certainly not the easy way.
I just had the most traumatic event ever. Seriously.
Yeah, hi... \.\.\.Again, sorry. I'm normally not so jumpy.
I mean, you won't believe what happened.
I was running on an off-road path here in Bergen Trail.
Suddenly, this \c[3]HUGE\c[0] and \c[3]VICIOUS\c[0] bunny-creature attacks me from the side.
I was so surprised I just ran down here and collapsed.
I mean I heard there was a super strong monster in the mountains but...
I can't believe it. I have to be much stronger.
I should not be scared by some monster. It's just a game, right?
I should find this thing and give it a good spanking!
Right! But\..\..\.. how about you help me?
You know, ease into the action and all the buzz?
I'll reward you too! Come on!
I think we should start by asking my friends about that thing.
Both of them are pretty smart and they always know stuff.
One of them is a \c[3]Hexacast\c[0] and is in Rookie Harbor.
Not sure exactly where he is though. I remember him saying something about an \c[3]INN\c[0] he loves.
The other is a \c[3]Triblader\c[0]. I should be at the Obelisk in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0].
I'll send word to both of them, via \c[3]Direct Link\c[0] so they know that you'll come.
Sorry, I not a fan of this "Messaging". I like to handle things personally.
While you talk to these guys, I'll talk to the people here.
By the way, what's your name? I'm \c[3]Jean\c[0]!
Is you'r speech module someone jammed? Kinda seems like it.
Ah I see. Must be hard using the Direct Link.
I'll include this in my message to the boys.
Hey Lea! You want me to tell you where you can find those guys again?
One of them is a \c[3]Hexacast\c[0] and is in Rookie Harbor.
Not sure exactly where he is though. I remember him saying something about an \c[3]INN\c[0] he loves.
The other is a \c[3]Triblader\c[0]. I should be at the Obelisk in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[0].
I've send word to both of them via \c[3]Direct Link\c[0], so they should know you come.
Okay, no problem! I hope I find out more here.
I just heard back from the guys!
I can't believe this. I told them to not \c[3]DL\c[0] me...
Then again\..\..\.. Your speech module is broken. So it's probably better this way.
So, from \c[3]Jeff\c[0] we know that we need 5 \c[3]\v[item.139.name]s\c[0].
And from \c[3]Jock\c[0] we know that we need a capture device.
And I found out that this creature seems to show up a lot on the \c[3]Windy Climb\c[0] parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0].
You go and collect the \v[item.139.name]s and I'll try to get my hands on one of these capture devices.
We'll meet here again once we're finished, alright?
You're back! And just in time too.
Yeah it was super expensive, but it's totally worth it.
Now we only have to capture this legendary bunny or whatever people call it.
From what I understood, the guys I got my info from said you have to bring the \v[item.139.name]s to \c[3]Windy Climb\c[0].
As I said, it's a part of Bergen Trail.
Turns out, it was the same part I was attacked in!
Right? Which means, we just have to get the \v[item.139.name]s to that place.
The guys said, just having the capture device and defeating the monster would capture it.
So\..\..\.. Here you go. Take the device.
What? \.\. Did you think I would get up there again?
Come on, you got the carrots too. I'm not really a fighter...
It's not because I'm scared or whatever.
Thanks! I know you can do it! But prepare yourself!
This creature must be super strong.
Hey Lea! Did you fight the bunny yet?
A.. Ah.. Alright. Don't push yourself okay? I was told it is super strong!
It should be somewhere in the \c[3]Windy Climb\c[0] parts of Bergen Trail!
Wait... does that mean \..\..\.. you captured it?
I bet it was super hard to beat, right?
Thanks so much Lea! C... Can I have?
Wow, kinda looks like a normal \c[3]\v[combat.name.gray-frobbit]\c[0] don't you think?
I thought it would have dark red eyes and bloody fur or something.
Well, what matters is that we captured it, right?
I have to log off and show this to my friends. They won't believe it!
A live legendary monster in my inventory! \.\.Super awesome!
Here, take this as a reward.
Bye Lea! Hope to speak to you soon!
... I assume that means: Me too?
Hehe, no problem. It was nice meeting you.
You are not going to tell her it is just a regular \v[combat.name.legend-frobbit]?
Mh.. I guess it is probably better his way.

\i[arrow-n] Ascent to Bergen Village
\i[arrow-s] Autumn's Rise

\i[arrow-s] Autumn's Rise

\i[arrow-s] Autumn's Rise
