So where is Monsieur Fancy Pants? Don't tell me he's late...\.
It is time for our duel!
As for the location, this place here is just perfect.
People should witness the grace of the Spheromancer's fighting style!
Now, there is no reason to rush.
Prepare yourself and tell me when you're ready to start.
And don't even think about chickening out.
Hell no! We're gonna show you!
Must I remind you of the definition of a duel?
I'm gonna watch as Lea will beat you up!
Anyway. Just talk to me, when you're ready.
I see you're currently at \c[3]level \v[player.level]\c[0]. I'm currently at \c[3]level 10\c[0].
You can still challenge me, but I don't even think about using the level difference as an excuse.
Are you ready for the duel?
Pentafist! It's time for you to step back.
What is it? Is this your first PvP battle?
We fight several round.\. \c[3]5 out of 9\c[0].\. No items.\. No escape.
Go Lea!!\. I'm sure you can do it!
I, \c[3]Apollo\c[0], will show you the right path.
The path of a proper Spheromancer!
Alright. Don't make we wait for too long here.
This round goes to you. Not bad!
Time to show you the true potential of a Spheromancer!
Witness the true potential of a Spheromancer!
Don't give up, Lea!\. Punch him!\. Punch him hard!
It looks like I underestimated you.
Yes, you are indeed a worthy opponent!
I'm glad to know that skilled Spheromancers are still among us.
You have yet to unlock the true potential of this class!
It looks like you still have much to learn.
You are nowhere close to unlocking the true potential of the Spheromancer!
Train hard, and you may become worthy of your class!
Next time we meet, I'll make sure to test your skills once more!
Looks like you got yourself a rival, Lea.
You really did kick his derrière, though! That was awesome!
Well, don't worry too much for losing this duel.
That guy seemed pretty experienced, non?
I'm sure you'll have plenty opportunity to get your revenge!
Anyway... I really have to go now.
Seriously, we've been playing for so long!
But it was so much fun!
So let's play together again next time, d'accord?
It looks like I added the word just in the nick of time.
I figured you'd need it sooner or later.
Well then, I think we should call it a day as well.
I kind of need the brake myself, to be frank.
Don't worry... We'll be back in the game soon enough.

This is currently the end of the story!
You can still continue from here and explore the area!
Aheads await \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0], \c[3]Bergen Village\c[0] and the \c[3]Cold dungeon\c[0]!
The story will continue with the next release!
Bonjour, Lea!\. How are you doing?
Oh this? It's a direct link! It's what you use to call people within CrossWorlds.
Anyway, I'm currently just running around randomly! Just call me if you want to form a party!
Learn how to invite and remove party members.
Select a party member to open the submenu.
Use these options to \c[3]invite\c[0] contacts to your party or \c[3]remove\c[0] them. You can also simply \c[3]contact\c[0] them for a small chat!

Oh sorry, is this for me?
Oh cool, didn't expect this so soon. Thanks a bunch!

You made it to \c[3]Bergen Village\c[0]! Since we pushed the dungeon up ahead a lot of the village is currently a bit empty. But you can already visit some houses and some even contain NPCs! the next update will include more NPCs!
I know that you wanna meet up with your friends, but do we have to stand out in the cold?\. I'm freezing!
Maybe I want them to see us without searching half the town.
Besides, why are you complaining about the virtual cold anyway?
Hey, you can modify your Avatar-senses remember?\. Got them sized at max!
Alright, but... why would you do that and then complain?
How would I be able to properly roleplay without that part of immersion, duh?
Oh...\.\.\. Oh...\.\.\. What should I do?
I'm sorry I'm just too distracted to really talk right now.
You probably know who I am right?
Wait what? Really? \.\.\. But I'm \c[3]Holiday Man\c[0]!
Gifting people and bringing joy and peace to people? No?
Aw man... \.\.\. Maybe you are just new here...
Whatever, I don't have the time!
Look, I have to get all these presents here to certain players in CrossWorlds.
And I have to do it NOW.
Wait\..\..\.. I know this comes out of nowhere, could you help me?
I promise you get something too!
Yes! Thank you so much. This makes things so much easier.

Alright, let's split the work. You go find the players here in \c[3]Bergen\c[0], then \c[3]\v[area.bergen-trails.name]\c[0], \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0] and finally \c[3]\v[area.rookie-harbor.name]\c[0].
I will take care of the west and north of CrossWorlds.
I don't really know who they are... It's a kind of secret Santa thing.
But in each area it's always a \c[3]Triblader\c[0], \c[3]Hexacast\c[0], \c[3]Pentafist\c[0] and \c[3]Quadroguard\c[0].
You will know when you find them.
Well... Come back once you're done, okay?
You still have some presents left to give I see.
Don't wait to long, we'll have to do this quick!
Oh... you are back! We have a problem!
I was on my way to my secret place to get some present for the rest of them...
...and this weird looking snowman just popped up and attacked.
I couldn't do anything. I'm good at gifting people stuff, not fighting.
You gotta help me! If we don't defeat this thing, all of the presents might get destroyed!
Okay, my secret stash is over here.
I'll lower the wall so you can get in.
Did you do it? Did you defeat the gift destroying fiend?
Oh you did? Ha! What a relieve...
"Lea" is not the answer I expected.
Oh no, how rude of me to not ask for your name.
No wonder you've been so quiet all the time.
Don't worry about my presents! I will check for myself.
Thanks a lot for helping me with all of this.
Ahm... \.\.\. Here, take my hat as a reward!
May it bring as much joy to you as it did to me!
Don't worry the hat is almost new!
I knew you would like it!
Again, thanks a lot! Let's chat again soon!
Hey Lea, nice to see you!
I have to say, without my hat, I feel kinda\..\..\.. naked.
But it does suit you much better!
You see this house over there?
The townsfolk is pretty quiet about it, but something very very strange is going on over there.
On some night, I swear I see light coming out of the cracks even though the house is abandoned for years.
Urgh, this guy is blocking the storage house again.
I wish he would meditate somewhere else. Or waterfall or whatever.

\i[arrow-nw] Old Temple Mine
\i[arrow-w] Bergen Railway
\i[arrow-se] Bergen Trail
Hey there!\. Do you like Mr. Cottonsnow here?
How nice of you!\. It took me a while to get him the perfect hat, but it just looks so precious on him!
Oh, hello!\. Can I help you or do you just wanna admire this handsome image of coolness here?
Ah, want to know about that hat of his?\. Yeah, I made it myself!
I can make you one as well if you want. But those materials I need... those are really tricky to get!
Especially the old hats... you can get them from his less sophisticated brothers in Bergen Trail.
But you need to defeat them \c[3]with style!\c[0] Otherwise those fancy hats will just mysteriously disappear...
Heya!\. Still searching for those things?
Don't forget to keep a fancy \c[3]rank\c[0] while hunting those mean snowfiends!\. Otherwise no hats for you.
Ooh, there you are again. And you got everything, yay!
You just wait right here!\. I'll have those pretties patched up in a flash!
I can make even more for you if you want!\. Just bring the materials and I'll work my magic!
Oh, a random gift. Swell. We take those.
Foolish people have angered the Track in their search for riches.
Now the cold streaming from the mine is as if the mountain itself is restless and trying to cast us away.
But remember this, \v[lore.title.seeker]: The Track respects those that beat it's challenges according to the traditions.
Thus, if you are deemed worthy, it will arm you with the power needed to face your obstacles.
Alright, the first dungeon is just ahead.\. Just stay calm and remember the basics and you should be fine!
I guess. Still...\. I've always been fighting \c[5]in groups\c[0] up until now so it's a bit of a change.
Oh, hey there. Are you also on your way to the \c[3]first dungeon\c[0]?
It's not that hard but a lot of new players are scared of it, especially since you gotta do it \c[3]on your own\c[0].
Yeah, I was confused about that as well...
The puzzles are a core element of those temple-dungeons and they wouldn't really work in groups of random sizes.
So it makes sense to restrict them to solo-instances.\. You gotta prove your own skills to progress in the story.
Alright, alright.\. But you better not complain if I take forever to beat it then...
Don't worry, I'll even stick around if you need moral support or calming words via \v[lore.title.direct-link].
And in a creepy cold mine out of all places.\. Brrr...
Those dungeons are very puzzle-heavy to test our skills as players.
I guess doing them in groups would distort the challenge.
As for the cold: Just think of the rewards you'll get and you should feel much warmer already.
If I dont freeze down there all by myself...
Oh come on, cut the drama...
Hello player and welcome to the \v[lore.unlock.omni-gilders]\c[3]Omni Gilders\c[0].
We are a guild of traders who try to extend their reach through offering players simple quests.
And I'm a humble general. Kind of a manger for the guild.
Might I interest you in said quests?
No need to come back to me by the way.
The items will be transferred here as soon as you find them.
Well, no problem. We can find someone else.
Hey, we don't have any other requests right now.
Just finding the items we asked for is enough.
You're back. Thanks for getting those items.
We really need some low-level trade stuff.
We won't be able to extend our base otherwise.
Don't worry too much about, the higher-ups already started giving quests to low-level players.
So we don't need to lift a finger?\. I like it.
Until we have to grind high level mobs...
I'm currently away from keyboard running some errands. Will be back later.
And you even found the guild I'm in!
It might look small, but it's really just a small branch.
It's actually one of the largest in CrossWorlds!
Yeah I know, pretty cool right?
We're currently looking for player helping us by finding some trade items.
So if you have some time, just talk to the pentafist over here.
Sorry, but I can't let you through here.
So, are you gonna tackle the mine as well?\. Apparently it is necessary to progress in the storyline.
I don't know, man.\..\..\. it might just be a game, but I don't want to get into trouble.
Someone told me that there is a "hot surprise" inside and that you should be above 18 to go in.
That's still a few weeks away for me, y'know...?
Uhh.\..\..\. You might've mixed something up there...
Aye, girl, what can I get ya?
"Hi" ain't no drink I know about.
Aye, girl, what can I get ya?
Nope, no drink I know about either.
You heard about the temple mine lately?
You bet I did! Heard the whole place changed completely.
Yey, word is, something very strange is going on in that mine.
You were there when it happened right?
I sure was. Still have \c[5]nightmares\c[0] about this scream.
The mine in the north was our biggest one.
We used to mine for rare ores there.
Some day however, there was the most awful sound from the depths of the mine.
After that, all the robots we used turned on us.
No one really knows what happened. But we assume it has something to do with the temple we discovered.
Apparently it's some old ruin left by these \c[3]Ancients\c[0].
No,\. no,\. no!\. This just won't do!
Greetings, young lady.\. You seem to be a person of refined taste.\. An unexpected sight indeed.
Ah, it's terrible. I've been travelling far and wide in search for the perfect hat and now I am here in this backwater village in the snow.
I heard tales of a legendary piece of headwear called the \c[3]"Tophat"\c[0] being crafted here.\. A hat once seen fit only for the noblest of pates!
But so far the only ones I've seen were the ruined pieces of rag worn by those terrible snowcreatures.
You, though.\. You seem to have an adventurous spirit. Maybe you can help me find craftmanship worthy to meet my expectations?
Magnificent!\. I heard that the crafting of Tophats hasn't entirely been forgotten in this place.\. Someone might still be skilled in it.
Though, I was not able to properly communicate with the crude natives of this place, so that task is up to you.\. May the smell of beauty guide you!
Oh, the stinging thrust of disappointment.\. Please tell me once you do reconsider.
Ah, you have returned. Did you find my hearts desire?
Oh?\. Then off you go again!\. There is greatness out there, waiting to be found!
Ah, you have returned. Did you find my hearts desire?
Ahh, spledid!\. Please, show it to me!
Mhm... this.\. This is fine work indeed, but\..\..\..\. Something is missing.
It seems like I haven't fully discovered the art I seek\..\..\..\. yet.
Still, I thank you for your diligent work.\. You can keep the hat. I'll need to continue my research.
Our Bergen ores are of the highest quality!
Greetings! Please take a kind look at our humble provisions!
To become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0] you first need to master all \c[3]4 Elements\c[0].
The first element, Heat, lies ahead in the \v[lore.unlock.temple-mine.first]\c[3]Temple Mine\c[0].
Prepare. It will test your wits before granting you new powers.
To become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0] you first need to master all \c[3]4 Elements\c[0].
I sense you unlocked the mysteries of the \c[3]Heat\c[0] Element.
Use it wisely as the path ahead is filled with obstacles only an Avatar can overcome.
To become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0] you first need to master all \c[3]4 Elements\c[0].
I sense you unlocked the mysteries of the \c[3]Cold\c[0] Element.
Never waver in face of peril and press forward, the cold should never bother you anyway.
To become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0] you first need to master all \c[3]4 Elements\c[0].
I sense you unlocked the mysteries of the \c[3]Shock\c[0] and \c[3]Wave\c[0] Element.
You have become a \c[3]True Avatar\c[0]... It's time for you final challenge.
There is no rush, take your time.
You did it.\. Yay and stuff.
What a convenient stage we have here!
Now, it is time to face your trial!
Let us see if you are the genuine article!
A display of your talents shall suffice as proof!
I am just as confused about this whole situation as you are...
It is certainly a mess, but we will get you out of this.
For now, take on this challenge and keep him busy.
I know, this enemy looks intimidating, but do not lose hope!
I am confident you will be able to handle this!
... Because I can see its battle stats.\. They match your level!
Cap, I'm back with the report!
Aye... hard to miss that lass.\. Hope ye didn't run into everythin' with those horns there.
Wait...\. don't tell me ya didn't notice the horns 'til now, Lea...
Anyway, make sure ye clean up that mess ye started down in the cargo hold soon.
I hope Sergey is satisfied.\. Is he around?
Yeah, just let me setup your headset for a sec.
My good man! It's been a long time.
Indeed.\. You are still clinging to that jet pack, I see?
Ye know I'd never travel the sea without good ol' Betty.
Anyway, I hope ye two will be ready to travel on soon.
An avatar on board just calls for darn trouble.
Of course.\. We will make this as brief as possible.
Gee, Cap.\. What kinda welcome is that s'posed to be?
Also, ain't we talkin' to Jet, former VRP-Dueling-Champ?
You keep telling us about all your combat moves from the old days.
So here I thought maybe you'd want to give Lea a small combat lesson?
Ye're tellin' me that wee lass is up for a battle?
Right, we'll see about that.\. Just talk to me later t'day.
Ye can show the lass around the ship, but don't ye stir up any trouble.
C'mon, Lea!\. It's time for some fresh air!
This is no place for ye, lass.\. Go play somewhere else.
There ye are.\. It's about darn time for yer combat lesson.
Good.\. Let's go to the balcony.
Do ye still need to prepare yerself?\. I don't got all day, lass.

Is that blue guy still out there?\.
Seriously, we never had anything like this happen before.
You'd think they'd make sure players can't escape the playground or something.
Girl! Skip the chatting, will you? We have to hurry!
Are you looking for the Captain?
I think he's currently somewhere in the cabins.
Indeed, even a captain needs a break once in a while...

You're that avatar girl we were warned about, right?\.
Sorry, but I need to pay attention to the radar.

desc: EventTrigger itsComing START IF plot.line >= 400 &&  tmp.enterBridge

text.en_US: It's still on the radar, approaching us at high velocity

desc: EventTrigger itsComing START IF plot.line >= 400 &&  tmp.enterBridge

text.en_US: No transmission, no darn ship to see.\. What's goin' on here?

desc: EventTrigger itsComing START IF plot.line >= 400 &&  tmp.enterBridge

text.en_US: Captain! I think I caught it on satellite! You gotta see this!
...Whoa!\. You speak!\. Is your voice finally back?
Her speech synchronization is still malfunctioning.
I just hard coded the word "Hi" into her speech module.
That is all she can say for now.\. I am currently working on adding more words.
I see... It's a beginning, I s'pose.
Anyway, Cap and I here have been planning out your combat training, girl.
We're almost set and good to go, right?
Aye, this is gonna be interestin'.
So, I'll be off to my cabin for some last preparations.
I'll be done in no time, so just stick with the captain 'kay?
Aye, I'll be back at the bridge. Ye can talk to me when ye're ready for the lesson.
Make sure ye're prepared.\. I'll be expectin' yer full attention.
Make sure ye clean up the kitchen after ye're done cookin', understood?
It's not like we forgot since the last time he told us.

desc: EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200

text.en_US:
Oh my...\.
Look at this mess.\. The Captain will surely not like this.

desc: EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200
EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200
EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200

text.en_US: Jet runs a strictly regimented ship.\. Every room needs to be cleaned before work.

desc: EventTrigger messy START IF subevent.carla.messy.start && plot.line < 200

text.en_US: I wonder how these guys managed to skip Jet's daily inspection.
Oh! I thought they canceled this game!

He seems pretty engaged with the game.\.
We should just let him play...
Oh!\. You must be the avatar the captain told us about.
Well, feel free to check out the ship.
It's just one of the small ships of the Solar class but it does its job.
But I suggest you don't go near the room across the hall...
So you checked out the room across the hall?
Don't mind it.\. Normally every room has to be clean.
But somehow she manages to get around captain Jet's inspections.
Hey there, Lea.\. You better not keep the Captain waiting.
Wait Carla... is this your room?
Sure is.\. Something wrong with it?
I mean, how did Jet not see this... \! room?
Well, you'll have to wait for another time for my secrets I guess.
I'm sure the Cap wants to start teaching Lea some new tricks.
Well, I guess we should go then...
Hey there, Lea.\. You better not keep the Captain waiting.

desc: EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10
EventTrigger messy end? START IF subevent.carla.messy.start2 && subevent.carla.messy.progress >= 10

text.en_US: THE TIME FOR REVENGE IS NIGH!

Awesome! You mastered the final challenge! 
This is all for now. 
Thanks for playing!

desc: EventTrigger enterRoom2 START IF map.entered || true

text.en_US: Get ready for the final challenge!

Thanks a lot for completing this tech demo of CrossCode!
If you like what you saw, please tell your friends!
We'd like to get word around! :D
Also, follow us on Facebook and Twitter!

Wait, we're not done yet!
From here on we have a small challenge for you to master, if you like to bash some more enemies. 
Have fun!
Lea, you don't open presents like this!
Come on, Ms. Avatar!\. There are still some boxes left.
Come on, Ms. Avatar! There are still some boxes left.
I got a friend back home who's a regular CrossWorlds player.
I seriously envy him!\. I didn't use to have the money for the game and now... well... I'm on a ship.
But at least now I can claim to have seen a real-life avatar in person!
Maybe some day I'll be finally be able to play CrossWorlds as well.\. And then, who knows, we might just meet again!
Dear me, I never knew my colleague was such a geek.
The whole day he's been blabbing about CrossWorlds and avatars and what not.
Well, admittedly CrossWorlds is pretty amazing.
I still find it hard to believe they managed to get all the resources to essentially turn this moon into high-technology theme-park.
... I suppose it's a good thing they did!\. It's one steady income for me, being a small cog in this machine.
And she's a Spheromancer class!\. How awesome is that?
Looks like you got your first fan, Lea.
Hey there, Carla. Good to see you.\. About all these strange boxes here...
Yeah... I know.\. I'm supposed to clean that up.
But right now I have to take care of the avatar, y'know?
I'll do it later today, okay?\. See ya later!
She said exactly the same thing yesterday.
Anyway, Carla just passed by us again.
She told us that you could take care of all these boxes here.
I mean, really, can you believe that woman?\. Now she's loading off her work on our guests.
It's easy to destroy these boxes with your avatar weapons, right?
Awesome!\. Please, I wanna see that!
Well...\. no pressure, you know.\. You are our guest after all.\. But you'd help us out a lot.
So, will you destroy the boxes for us?
Destroy all boxes in this room.
I'm really surprised how quickly those balls were flying.
What are you even talking about?
I didn't see any balls.\. Only those boxes disappearing for whatever reason.
Yeah, you need to wear these AR goggles to see them.
The balls and their impact are all like... virtual and stuff.
I see... so that's why you've been wearing these goofy glasses all day.
Goofy? You know nothing about style, Lady!
Anyway, thanks a lot for the help.
Yes!\. Thank you so much, Ms. Avatar!

Thanks a lot for completing this tech demo of CrossCode!
If you like what you saw, please tell your friends!
We'd like to get word around! :D
Also, follow us on Facebook and Twitter!

Wait, we're not done yet!
From here on we have a small challenge for you to master, if you like to bash some more enemies. 
Have fun!
Oh yeah, Lea?\. Just a heads up - don't worry about the captain being a bit on the grumpy side.
That's just the way he is.
Well, well... Our endeavor has not been concluded!
You will not escape our will!
Lea, those are high level opponents.
Do not fight them and run to the teleporter!
Girl, you sure are a natural with that ball thing!
Carla, they are called VRPs.\. Not "balls".
Ah, c'mon! Nobody calls them that anymore, y'know?
Well done!\. Yeah that was all.\. It's a small room.
What are ya standing around here for?\. The wall is gone, the path is clear.
Well something is different about this switch, right?
I'm afraid one ball just won't cut it.
Now, several balls on the other hand...
Nah, I won't give ya a hint for that, girl.
You removed the wall, the rest is straightforward.
Oh yeah, that one is kinda mean.\. Need a hint?
Did you try to hit this switch with charged balls?
You probably realize that doesn't work.\. It's too slow.
How about you look around?\. There might be another way.
Heh, this is so much fun.\. Just too bad we can't chat along the way...
Ah, don't worry!\. I'm sure Sergey will get the speech problem fixed in no time.
It is...\. challenging to say the least.
Please, a bit of optimism, sir...
Entering the next stage, more switches await!

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!
Oh yeah!\. Never mind the visor!\. I just need this to see what you're doing.
Do not worry about it for now.\. We will explain it to you later on.
Huh? Don't tell me you're already stuck?
Look, how about you try to jump over this container here?
That cardboard box ain't there for no reason
Walk toward small object to auto-jump on top of them.
So, that wall ain't there anymore. You're free to pass.
Now all that's left is some jumping over those containers.
Move toward edges to auto-jump over gaps.
You need to find a way to remove this wall.
Basic stuff Lea. You'll need to throw balls at something.\. That's all I'm gonna say.
Y'know, ball throwing is pretty much the solution to most obstacles around here.
Those boxes here are no exception.
Well, ain't that just another stupid wall....
But the color is different this time. Maybe that means something, who knows?
I'm pretty sure you yourself can't pass it.\. But maybe something else can...?
Well, won't ya look at all those switches! Need a hint?
Yeah, that switch is pretty well hidden, huh?
Remember those charged balls?\. Those bounce on walls, y'know?
I'm sure those will help ya out here.
See those switches on the containers? Yes, you can hit those. From a distance, that is!
Just make sure you throw the balls from the same height.
Really?\. You can't figure this one out?
Just jump over the boxes and hit that thing hard.\. That's all, really.
Right, then! Go on! You're almost there!
That's all for this room!\. Nice work, girl!
Your task is to reach the door at the other end of this room.
And don't mind me! I'll just stick along and keep an eye on ya.
Well... I might give you some hints. If you ask nicely, y'know?

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!

desc: EventTrigger ShreddersGo START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.shreddersStart && !map.shreddersSpawned

text.en_US: Damn, how're we gonna pass this one?!

desc: EventTrigger ShreddersGo START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.shreddersStart && !map.shreddersSpawned
EventTrigger Carla does Stuff START IF map.carlaDoesStuff

text.en_US: Carla, Instant Matter builder, at your service.
Welcome to rat's fortress, standing unpenetrated for centuries!
Apparently, somebody had a fun time putting this together.
Just hit 'em with those balls. That's all there is to it.
Yeah, you're probably missing the mouse robots here.
Those things are pretty small, y'know?\. Might be they're hidden somewhere...
Ain't no way you're getting close to those mouse robots in that corner.
But you can still hit them, y'know? Remember the red walls? Balls flying through them and all?
Girl, that was so quick!\. Took me forever to put all of this together.
Ha, finally!\. This one's my favorite!
Here you can go wild on these mouse robots!
It's a moving target practice!\. Have fun, girl!
Press \i[key-throw] repeatedly to hold down the enemies in a rapid fire.
Hold \i[gamepad-throw] to hold down the enemies in a rapid fire.

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!

desc: EventTrigger CarlaCheat START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.carlaCheat
EventTrigger CarlaCheat START IF plot.line >= 700 && tmp.carlaCheat

text.en_US: Time for turrets!\. Don't worry, those things won't hurt you.
This is in fact just a simple puzzle.
C'mon, you can do this yourself.\. Really want a hint?
Oh well.\. Look, these blocks are kinda like switches.
Only they don't react to the typical balls.
Maybe they react when hit by something else.
Attagirl! Use that pretty head of yours.
Hm, this one is a tiny bit more tricky. Need some help?
To make the turret hit these blocks you have to stand between turret and block.
Then you need to dodge the bullet right after it was shot.
You need to get the timing right.\. C'mon, I know you can do it!
It's actually almost the same as before.\. Only this time the turret and blocks are on a higher level.
So get up on that container in the middle and dodge some bullets!
These things are kinda unexpected, right?\. Need a hint?
That mirror-like thing only shoots bullets, when it's hit by your balls.
And it always shoots the bullets right at you.
You'll need a block between you and the mirror and still need to hit the mirror with one of your balls...
So here's the hint:\. Think bouncing balls!
Phew, that's all for this room.\. Lot's of puzzles, right?\. But don't worry, you will get some real action in the next room!
A bit of advice!\. Hit them with \i[tech]charged balls to cancel their attacks!
Enter that arena there to start the lil' sparring session.
If you liked this room, you're gonna love the next one, trust me!
Yes!!\. That was awesome, girl!\. Sergey, you were not kidding! She's really got a hang for battles.
Yeah, that sure takes me back.
Just a short warning.\. Here you'll meet your first "real" enemies.
And by "real" I mean those things will in fact attack you.
Don't get me wrong!\. They're really easy, but still....
If you do get beat down, your respawn point is right in this room.
Uhm...\. that means there is no real danger!\. Go ahead and kick some ass!
Ah, just a moment!\. Let me enable the dash module before we start the battle.
Dash is essential in battle, since it helps you to quickly dodge enemy attacks at any time.
Right he is!\. Now please enter to the right in order to proceed with the ass kicking.
Press \i[dash] while moving to dash, though only up to 3 times in a row. You can dash at any time, even while aiming.

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!
Amazing work!\. Numbers sure can't beat skill.
Would ya look at all those cowards ganging up on you!
But don't panic,\. just keep moving and strike fast!
Aaand another victory for our fearless gladiator Lea!\.
C'mon show me a right hook! \.\. And a left!
Standard VPI was not modeled after boxing\..\..\..
Nice moves!\. They didn't even see it coming.
Yeah yeah I know,\. a second waited is an attack wasted.
Still,\. you should know that your strikes have enough punch to interrupt some hostile attacks.
So you can just pummel your opponents without giving them a chance to strike back.
Sounds like a plan, am I right?\. So go get 'em!
Close in fast and whack 'em over the head!

Wrong direction, girl.\.
Gotta reach the teleporter!
Hey champ, get your adrenaline down again for a second.
We gotta add a bit more edge to your arsenal.\.\. A sharp one that is!
I see that got your attention.\.\. Sergey, you finished?
Yes.\.\.\. Unlocking Virtual Proximity Impact\..\..\..\. now.
...you can quickly tear through several targets in your path at once.
Only them close ones,\.of course.\. You got that?
Sharp as a blade!\. Now start by clearing that path for us, will ya?
Click \i[key-throw] near Lea inside the circle to perform a close-combat attack.
Press \i[gamepad-throw] without touching \i[right-stick] to perform a close-combat attack.
Just do a few warm-up swings on those pesky obstacles.
Just do a few warm-up swings on those pesky obstacles.
Don't worry, those are the same weaklings as before.
More punching bags await your blade.
And here we are at the last challenge.
Don't let the big number scare you and keep concentrated.
That was quite the ride, huh?
Aaand you just crossed the finish line!\. Congratz!
It's like you've never forgotten the basics at all.
Oh my, you still look so puzzled about all this.
I suppose it is about time we explain all the circumstances.
You bet it is.\. But let's take a short break before that, okay?
I still need to report to the captain.\. He wants to meet Lea as well.
Good idea.\. Better to not keep Jet waiting for too long.

desc: EventTrigger DesignerWarning START IF plot.line>= 700 && tmp.designerSay

text.en_US: We can sense your fear...\. your every step!

desc: EventTrigger DesignerAgain START IF tmp.designerAgain && map.shredder1

text.en_US: Let us follow Carla for now.
Y'know, the view here is nice, but you gotta see what's beyond the bow.
We're currently steering towards Rhombus Square. That's something to look at!
Actually, why not go to the bow and explain the situation to Lea there?
Seeing Rhombus Square will make it easier for her to understand, correct?
S...\. Sorry, I'm busy checking the containers here.
Hello there! You must be a guest on this ship, right?
Why, don't be shy! We seamen may look rough, but we're easy going folks, really.
You want to know what I'm doing here?
I'm currently checking up on the solar panels here.
These are our primary energy source, so they better work properly!
Otherwise our nice and shiny M.S. Solar won't budge a centimeter.
Trust me, being stuck in the ocean too long is not something you want to experience.
Just let me do my work, okay?
Huh... I suppose he did not even notice you are an avatar.
Well, the human appearance is pretty convincing.
You don't look like a proper seaman. So, I reckon you're a guest?
Not very talkative, huh? Sorry, I'm in the middle of a maintenance routine.
Ah, look who's there.\. You must be that avatar, right?
Well then, welcome to the M.S. Solar!
If you lean over the railing a bit you might even see the name of the ship.
Oi, make sure you don't fall into the sea.\. I'm pretty sure avatars are bad at swimming.
I have no idea what is going on, but you better listen to the Cap' and get going!
Hey, can't you see I'm busy here?\. ... Wait, who are you?
Oh right, I remember now.\. You're that pseudo-robot thing.
Oh, no offense.\. You see, I just recently had this discussion with a colleague.
It was about avatars being the same as robots.
And I have to insist they are not!\. Avatars are just some fragile, temporary collection of instant matter.
Everybody knows real robots are made of metal.\. Like these beauties here.
So I just can't share the excitement of my colleagues about your presence.
You're just an avatar.\. No true robot, see?
Anyway, I have to take care of my babies here.\. So if you'll excuse me...
Oh my!\. That's some extremely colorful hair you have there.
I had heard that avatar designs tend to be flamboyant, but... really?
You're not happy about them either, huh?
Now I have to wonder who put those things on you.
I expected the embodiment of some gamer kiddies wildest dreams.\. Lot's of beefcake and such.
Yet, here we have such a cute girl.
Too bad that doesn't really say anything about the player's actual appearance.
Just like in the old days of MMOs.\. Some things never change.

text.en_US: Have a look around the ship.
So, ye ready for the battle?
That's what I like to hear! Let the battle begin!
Well then, tell me when ye are.
Carla!\. Are ye ready up there?
Yes, Cap! Don't forget the goggles!
Haven't worn these for some time...
I was told ye learned the basics down in the cargo hold.
Still, first I want ye to show me yer grip on aimin' and throwin'.
Time to say hello to an old friend!
Listen carefully.\. I want ye to hit that robot from this distance ten times.
And do it quickly! Got that?
Quickly hit the target-bot ten times.
I see ye understand the basics well enough.
Aye, just as I expected. Ye notice how half o' them balls missed the target?
Ye still need to understand how to aim properly.
Be patient, lass!\. Ye missed yer target too often again.
Ye're supposed to quickly throw balls at the target.
Ye're supposed to throw quickly, lass!
Not one darn charged ball after the other, ye understand?
Should I explain the basics to ye again?
I'll show ye how it's done.\. Watch closely.
See them dotted lines? That's the throwing range.
When I now start throwin' balls, they'll be flyin' randomly in between the two lines.
That's some pretty darn sloppy throwin'.\. We won't have that here, ye hear me?
Now fact is, when ye be throwin' balls yer precision will improve over time, like this.
Then ye better \c[3]keep the aim\c[0] and \c[3]stop the darn throwin'\c[0]!
Once ye get yer lines connected, ye can throw with high precision.
See how ye \c[3]keep your precision\c[0] after throwin'?
Once ye got the lines connected ye can quickly throw as many precise balls as ye want!
But, yer precision is lost when ye \c[3]change yer aimin' direction\c[0] too quickly.
So in short: \c[3]Don't rush with the throwin'\c[0]!
First wait for a split second to get the precision.\. Then ye can throw to yer heart's content.
Ye better get it right this time around, lass.
Good, let's see if ye got the message.
Quickly hit the target-bot ten times.
Yer choice.\. Just keep in mind that good aim is essential for combat.
Carla!\. We need that turret now!
Time to turn on ol' Betty.
Next we'll be practicin' the dash.
The turret will now start shootin' at ye.
I want ye to do two things.
First, \c[3]keep yer aim\c[0] on the turret but \c[3]don't throw\c[0] anythin'.
Second, \c[3]dodge\c[0] the turret's bullets \c[3]without losin' yer aim\c[0].

Good. Note that the shield will only block the front. Always look into the direction of the attack.

Use \i[left-stick] while guarding to change view direction.

You can also aim while guarding with \i[throw].

text.en_US: Ms. Avatar! You totally rocked that crab! That was so awesome!
But that strange blue guy was pretty amazing, too!
Did you see how he just jumped up from the water?
Not to mention how he just dragged you through the air, telepathy style!
I'm sorry to interrupt, but we need you on the bridge!\. Right now!
Something is approaching us and quickly!
Sorry lass, we have to stop here.\. Duty calls.
Carla, ye clean up the balcony first and come to the bridge afterwards.
Girl, I have no idea what's going on here, but it'd be better for you to go inside, too.
What a particular location we have here.
It's a darn cargo ship, ye dobber!
Ye look like someone who jumped right out of CrossWorlds.
This ship is not part of the bloody playground.
So, don't be a nuissance and get lost.
We are aware of the nature of this place.
Yet we perceive the presence of another misplaced individual.
... That's none of yer bloody business!
Get off this ship and back to the game ye came from!
Foolish mortal, do you truly believe we will abide by your command?
... Did ye just call me a "mortal", ye nutcase?
Ye better leave right now or I'll be glad to tighten yer grip on reality!
You bore us.\. We choose to no longer converse with the likes of you.
Besides, our search has already been concluded.
You.\. You do not belong here.\. You need to be removed.
Wait, you seem all too familiar.
Indeed, it might be a mere coincidence!
Oh, but we most definitely have a way to be certain!
I don't even know what to say!
I mean... seriously?\. What's next?\. Cyborg sea serpents?
This is the best day, man!
In all my years on this ship, this kind of thing never happened.
This spinning motion, one cannot find it twice in this world.
Truly, there is no doubt about it!
When was the last time we have laid eyes upon you?
Yes, you have our utmost interest!\. You will come with us.
Greetings from the Solar Fist, ye pile of instant matter!
What's this? Yer divine powers can't handle a proper explosion?
Okay, lass.\. Ye need to get off this ship.\. Right NOW!
Carla!\. Get her back to the teleporter as fast as possible.
And tell me once she's off the ship.
I'll make sure no trace of CrossWorlds is left on my ship!
Dude...\. I know you're new around here, but really, ya gotta be more relaxed about all this.
What? Just because I was too quick about cleaning duty?
Well, if ya keep this up, \c[5]people will notice\c[0].
Oh hey! You're that avatar girl right?
I was just giving our newbie here a lesson.
I've been working here for 6 months!
Ya sure? Before ya know it, ya'll be cleaning da whole deck back to front every day.
Dude...\. I know you're new around here, but really, ya gotta be more relaxed about all this.
What? Just because I was too quick about cleaning duty?
Well, if ya keep this up, people will notice.
Before ya know it, ya'll be cleaning da whole deck back to front every day.
Ye darn pile of instant matter!
Stop puttin' yer trash all over the ship!
There are probably some enemies left down in the cargo hold.
Puttin' even more trash in my cargo hold?
Okay, that's it, play time is over!!
You're meddling with matters that are not of your concern...
Dobbers like you messin' with my ship are on the bloody top of my list of concerns!
I said it before, I say it again:
This cargo ship is not part of the bloody playground!!
What the bloody hell was all that about?!

This tech demo is a gameplay focused excerpt of the game. 
Expect this to grow into an Action-RPG with lots of puzzle elements and a compelling story. 
That's at least the plan.
Have fun!
Oh, is the speech synchronization malfunctioning?
... Apparently. Well, something had to go wrong.
Ok. We will make it work, somehow.
You... are probably confused about this situation, correct?
Alright. Let us take small steps.
Carla? We are ready. Please initiate the training sequence.

Press \i[key-throw] to aim.
Release \i[key-throw] to throw.

Use \i[right-stick] to aim.
Press \i[gamepad-throw] to throw.
VRPs are your most essential tool and weapon.
Your task is to hit all these robots with VRPs.

So, give it a shot!\.
Or rather...\.\.\. a throw!

\i[gamepad-left] left, \i[gamepad-right] right, \i[gamepad-up] up, \i[gamepad-down] down.

You're a quite one, aren't you?
You're a quite one, aren't you?
Okay, so now you're leaving on me, huh?
Don't you also feel a bit lonely around here?
I mean, it's not exactly the most crowded place, right?

So I don't know about you, but I do feel pretty lonely around here...

Maybe keep Carla alone after all...

That's all the content we have for you right now! 
Expect more content - and story - with the next release!
Hey, you kinda look like me #whathappens
Really? Alright, talk to me again if you changed your mind!
Go on, do that quest for me!
Hey, I just unlocked a Lore Entry about \v[lore.unlock.charas-lea]\c[3]Lea\c[0]!

A rock formation!
You're filled with \c[3]Determination\c[0]

O hai Lea.
Kill all the evil robots to leave The Room.
This is just some Test task!
Guys, check out cool message system I came up with!
I'm not even sure what I'm doing here!
Make sure to hit those enemies with balls.
Welcome stranger. Good luck with this and remember: Cloudy drink kills frog!
I know you can here me! Where is he?!
So, you keep him here? What the heck are you doing?!
You know that there is no other way...
No, you have to stop using him like this!
I know you can hear me! Where is he?!
Shizuka, I have to ask you to leave.
So, you keep him here? What do you think you are doing?!
Time is running short. We don't have a choice!
So you abduct a dying person and make him work until his last breath? Is that it?!
I will go and talk some sense into him! Don't get in my way!
What do you think you are doing?!
You are in no condition to do this kind of work now!
All you should do is rest...
... Why should I rest when I'm way beyond recovery?
I need to finish this work. It's my final task.
... I told you about the agreement.
I finish this and they will let you go...
I'm so sorry I got you involved with this.
Just promise me...\. that you will...\. get away...
I'm sorry but I can't let you go any further.
You have to do better than that.
You know this is what he wants as well!
Sure, you'd like to think that!
You don't know when to stop, do you?
You can throw as many enemies at me as you like.
The level threshold doesn't exactly work in your favor.
If you interrupt him, all of his hard work will be lost.\. Don't do this!
So?\. It never should have happened in the first place!
Oh, they added a welcome sign. Very hospitable.
Are you looking for that redhead pentafist from before?
Well... I am afraid you will not find her here.
You see, each player is placed into a separate instance of these rooms.
You will find plenty of puzzles ahead.
You really would not want other players to interfere around here.
So it is all about who will be fastest by themselves, right?

A Chest! Some yummy \c[3]\v[item.1.name]s\c[0] were inside.
A Chest! But what is inside?
Alright Lea... I will be gone for a couple of minutes.
I will contact Jet and Carla and try to investigate that blue individual.
I am sure you will be fine by yourself. See you later!
...I really have to work on your vocabulary.
THE TIME FOR REVENGE IS NIGH!

text.en_US: Oh...\. Right, enemies start to give EXP at this point.
Greetings from Jet and Carla.\. Everything is back to normal on the M.S. Solar.
There are no traces left of that blue individual.
I also tried to find something about him, but there is nothing.
We can be pretty certain that he is not connected to the official game.
I just cannot imagine a regular player leaving CrossWorlds and going on a rampage like this.
Something very strange is going on here.
...\. Not to mention that he recognized you.
Your memory might in fact contain some answers to all of this.
Anyway, there is no need to worry about this right now.
Our goal is simply to play CrossWorlds!
And I see you made a lot of progress already!
You already reached level 3?\. That is strange.
I thought you were supposed to reach level 2 at this point.
I suppose they may have added more enemies...

text.en_US: \c[3]Equip items\c[0] to prepare yourself for battle.
I have a little upgrade for you myself!
I finally managed to add another word to your vocabulary.
Well, you know how it is.\. No shiny effects from me.\. Just the upgrade.
I think you will need this one, since I will not be able to introduce you to others anymore.
Do not look at me like that...
I know it takes a long time to add these words.
It is a very involved process, actually.
I need to manually extend your Thought Control Model...
...essentially modifying a statistically generated code base by hand.
The technology to control avatars is...\. well...\. complicated.
Anyway, the second word is done.\. I will work on the next one right away!

text.en_US: You now got \c[3]special points\c[0] (SP) used for \c[3]combat arts\c[0].
That was fun! Can't wait to reach the mainland.
You can quickly reach all of CrossWorlds from here.
Though there should only be one destination for us newbies: \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0].
This is the central teleportation hub of this world.
From here you will be able to quickly travel to all locations you have reached on the mainland.
Note that new recruits will only be able to travel to \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0] at first.
You will visit several locations as you travel along the \c[5]Track of the Ancients\c[5].
Do you want to know more about the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0]?
The \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0] is an ancient \c[3]assessment system\c[0] based on a highly advanced technologie.
As Seekers it is your task to walk the Track and discover all the secrets it holds.
Once you reach \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0] you can attend the Introductory briefing to learn more about it.
Once you reach a new major location on the mainland, a connection to the CrossCentral will be established for quick travel.
Huh, those poor advisor NPCs. Just explaining the same thing over and over again.
You know that those NPCs are actually artificial intelligences, right?
Yeah, it's hard to tell at the beginning, but you will notice eventually.
Their interactions with players are somewhat limited.
Man, we've come pretty far with AI research, haven't we?
Sure... yet we still have trouble passing the \c[5]Turing Test\c[0].
Hey there, can we help you?
Oh, are you wondering about the \c[3]Turing Test\c[0]?
Oh? You're a curious one, I like that!
The Turing Test is quite simple:
You have two people writing each other via text.
The twist: one of them is actually a machine.
If the actual person can tell from the conversation that the other person is a machine, you fail the Turing Test.
It's difficult, because it's not just about simulating natural language.
The machine needs to have a memory, general knowledge and many other things to properly respond like a human being would.
Oh! It's you from Newcomer's Bridge again.
Look, we're getting closer to the mainland!
If you look closely, you can already see Rookie Harbor on the horizon.
You can go ahead! Just take any of those sky rail terminals.
Ha!\. ...\. Told you I would be...\. first...
Ah oui~\. But wasn't that fun?
I was very surprised by that boss at the end!
Um...\. Pardon.\. I didn't even introduce myself.
So...\. Are you ready to take the sky rails?
I wish we could already explore the city itself, but non~
Didn't you know?\. The sky rail will take you straight to \c[3]CrossCentral\c[0].
From there you'll be transported to the mainland.
You will only be able to enter Rhombus Square much later.
Before, you just appeared out of nowhere.\. Suspicious!
And what do I see now?
And this is unheard of.\. I'm forced to assume~
Monsieur going straight for the accusations?
How can you be so sure about it?
Just because you are stuck at level 3 doesn't mean...
No player on record has ever reached this point at level 4.
Young lady, surely I don't need to explain to you the faults of such actions.
Cheating will never pay off in the long run!
Is that all you have to say?
Oh dear, what is going on here?
Jörk, I have exposed this cheater here.
Yes, about the wrongness of her actions!
I'll just go ahead and pretend I don't know you.
He sometimes pretends to be a moderator.\. He is not.
Young lady, I'll let you off this time.
Mon Dieu!\. What was the deal with him?
I hope you don't meet players like this too often around here.
I finally want to reach \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0]!
You can come with me, if you want to.
Woah...\. My heart just stopped there for a second.\. That was close.
It is all because you collected those extra EXP from that \c[3]crab boss\c[0].
I should have noticed this earlier.\. Sorry.
From here you can take the sky rails to reach \c[3]CrossCentral\c[0].
No floor... there is no floor....
You just fly through the air... it's all transparent!
Please stay strong, just this one last time.
I'm sure things will be better once we reach the mainland.
Dear Seekers, you are now permitted to enter the \c[3]mainland of Shadoon\c[0].
You can take the sky rails from here to reach \c[3]CrossStation\c[0], our central teleportation hub.
Note that as new Seekers you are not yet permitted to enter the \c[3]city of Rhombus Square\c[0].
Such permission will be granted once you've made sufficient progress along the \c[5]Track of the Ancients\c[0].
Do you want to know more about the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0]?
The \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0] is an ancient \c[3]assessment system\c[0] based on a highly advanced technologie.
As Seekers it is your task to walk the Track and discover all the secrets it holds.
Once you reach \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0] you can attend the Introductory briefing to learn more about it.
Those sky rail terminals will bring you to \c[3]CrossStation\c[0].
You can take any one of them, they all go to the same place.
Woah, this city looks huge! And so clean and shiny!
Yeah, and they won't let you in it until much later.
Well, in case you are wondering why I'm sitting here...
Apparently he felt sick after the last stage.
Now I have to wait here for him to come back.
Damn it, I want to go on so badly!
Aww, don't look so sorry! We're talking first world problems here.
That turret boss at the end was pretty cool, huh?
Most def! That ball streaming attack was intense, dude!
I also like how it was mostly about ranged combat.
Whatcha talking about, dude? I just went in and punched it hard!
What?\. How did you do that?\. It moved to the center of that hole in the second phase, didn't it?
Well, I just jumped on its platform and did ma punching!\. Also, some dodging.
That sound like a risky tactic.
Well, I ain't choosing a Pentafist for no reason! Gotta punch stuff! That's ma skill, dude!
I still can not believe what just happened on the M.S. Solar.
Anyway, we are now in the official Playground.
This area is packed with all kinds of security measures.
More interference from that blue individual is highly unlikely here.
For now, let us just proceed.
This is the official introduction to CrossWorlds.
I placed you right in front of the last stage.
It is important that we do this part the official way to avoid suspicion.
It is absolutely essential that you pass as a regular player.
We must avoid being reported at any cost.
Do not worry too much about your speech synchronization issues.
You are in fact not the first player with these problems.
Most of these players here should be newcomers just like you.
Veterans usually skip this part, obviously.
C'mon there is no need to be afraid.
You know I can't deal with heights...
It's all a game, there's no danger, y'know?
I know... It just feels so real.
Just give me some time, ok?
First a greeting and now silence? You're a strange one.
S-Sorry... that came across the wrong way.
You're here for the view, right?
CrossWorlds expands over the whole land you see up there.
People call it the \c[3]Croissant\c[0]... because the island is shaped like one.
It's not my first time up here.
I usually redo the introduction phase with each character.
I just enjoy the view from here.

text.en_US: Dear \c[3]Seekers\c[0], you're about to enter the final stage of Newcomer's Bridge.
You will be confronted with a multitude of puzzle and combat situations.
Make use of all the skills you learned in the previous stages!
Expect your skillset to be further expanded over the course of the final stage.
As a reward for passing Newcomer's Bridge you will be granted access to the mainland.
Please step on the red teleport panel to enter the final stage.
Dang, I can barely see a thing!
"You totally should choose a short avatar", they said.
You're on the same page, huh?
Congratulations on passing the third stage of Newcomer's Bridge!
You have just arrived at the final waiting area.
You can take a break here and enjoy the view.
Once you are ready, proceed to the teleporter at the other end of this area to enter the final stage!
Yeah, good thing they added those laser railings!
The best type of lasers there is.
Ocean as far as the eye can see.
Huh... now since we're on an alien planet...
It makes you wonder what kind of sea life you'd find down there.
Hell yeah! You think we can just jump down into the water with our avatars and explore?
More like "explode"... I heard avatars are not all that water resistant.
One step at a time, Carla.
Lea, do you remember the concept of an MMOG?
Well, MMOG stands for "Massively Multiplayer Online Game".
It is a video game that supports a large number of players simultaneously.
Usually, all these players are connected to a virtual environment from all around the world.
Now, CrossWorlds is like an MMOG, just with one striking difference.
The world of this game is not virtual.\. It is real.
All players are remotely connected to this world through special avatars.
These avatars have a physical form and are tightly connected to all 5 senses of the player.
And you, Lea, are currently logged into this game as well.
Oh, me?\. No, I'm not a player.\. I just work here!
In fact, you're the only avatar on this whole ship.
That is correct.\. This cargo ship belongs to the maintenance staff of CrossWorlds.
The actual game takes place in the land you see over there - the Playground.
The reason you are here, Lea, is because you are not a regular player.
You have lost your memory and we are trying to recover it.
You see, you have been in this game before.
Being logged into this game, there is a chance you might remember your past.
And that is why we will try to get you into the real Playground soon.
Yeah, in fact you'll be going to that glass palace of a city over there!
That's Rhombus Square. It's where all players start.
Sorry, afraid we can't let ya pass.
Having some trouble moving those boxes.
Hey Lea! Please don't just run off like that, d'accord? We're over here!
Did you know that these treasure chests are instanced for each player?
Oh well.. it means I opened this treasure chest myself before.
The content is replicated for each player.
That's cool, right? No more annoying empty chests because some random player reached it before you!
Yeah.... anyway, gotta meet my friends at the entrance.
Heh, you reached this spot. Not bad!
No reason to hold back. Go claim your prize!
I wanna go through the market later~
Also wanna bath in that fountain, naked.

If you put water into a fountain...
It becomes the fountain.
You just jumped into the fountain, didn't you?
That's not how you become water, my friend.
Could I interest you in some cool and delicious ice cream?
Well... unfortunately we are out of stocks right now.
But: if you bring me some \c[3]fresh ice from Bergen Trail\c[0], I could quickly produce new ice cream.
So... could you bring me some \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0]? About \c[3]5\c[0] should suffice.
You find \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] in the snowy parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0].\. Just continued to the west until you reach the mountain area.
Do they seriously make you fetch ice from a distant mountain?
What is this, the middle ages?
Oh, that's too bad. Maybe another time!
Hm... it seems you don't have enough \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] yet. I need about \c[3]5 pieces\c[0].
You can find \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] in the snowy parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0]. Just continued to the west until you reach the mountain area.
Oh, you brought me the \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0]! Thank you so much!
And here you got your ice cream! Don't eat it all at once, it might make your head hurt!
You know what? They could have declared "Bergen Ice" a speciality.
That would explain why you'd had to go this distance to fetch it.
People still do all kind of elaborate tasks, because it's a speciality, you know?
Well, nevermind. I'm not a game designer.
Ice cream sure sells quickly when the weather is right.
I'm sorry, the northern part is currently under construction.
It will open up to the public with the next content update!
Sorry, northern part is blocked due to constructions.
It will be open with the next update again!
I'm really looking forward to the next content patch.
I heard rumors about a black market!
By the way, does it make sense to call it a "patch"?
I mean it's not just code. They do proper construction work over there.
It's just a habit from old virtual MMOs. Don't overthink it.
Yeah. I'm also still waiting for that kitchen patch.
My sink is broken. Landlord's gotta patch that!
Stop this, you make my brain hurt.
Where are you going Lea?\. We're over here!
Hmpf, didn't your father tell you not to startle people?
Kids these days, don't know their manners!
Now now, don't be sad young lady.
At least you look like you are actually sorry.
I think I like your attitude.
Look, if you want to make up for startling me, why not help me out?
Now don't look at me like this. It's not hard at all. All I want you to do is find me a \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0]. Simple enough, right?
Very good. Some player told me it was hidden in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[3].
Apparently there is an area where you have to defeat lots of \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]s\c[0] while it's raining.
Do you think you can find it?
Good to hear! But don't let me wait alright?
What? Young lady, I expected more of you!
But, I give you another chance, so come back when you are ready to redeem yourself.
Aha! Look who is back. Are you ready to help me now, young lady?
Very good. Some player told me it was hidden in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[3].
Apparently there is an area where you have to defeat lots of \c[3]hedgehags\c[0] while it's raining.
Do you think you can find it?
Good to hear! But don't let me wait alright?
What? Still nothing? My patience has its limit!
Welcome back young lady. Did you find the \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0] yet?
Oh, that's unfortunate. I do hope you find it.
Some player told me it was hidden in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[3].
Apparently there is an area where you have to defeat lots of \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]s\c[0] while it's raining.
Welcome back young lady. Did you find the \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0] yet?
I knew I can count on you.
Such a fine young lady with expert listening skills.
Thanks a lot. I even have a little something for you as reward!
A special disk. I'm not sure what it does, but maybe you can find out!
Oh, I never asked you for your name!
Well, I'm not good with long goodbyes, so let's keep this one short.
This guy just now... \.\.\. he looked like he wears parts from each class.
Normally that shouldn't be possible. I wonder how he managed to sneak this past the developers.
Dear Players, please note that as of now you can not enter the eastern part of the town.
A rare bug has occurred that can lead to disconnects and malfunctions in your Cross-Gear.
We are very sorry for the inconvenience.
Sheeesh, this is gonna take while...
How is it this happens so frequently as of late?
I'm sorry to inform you that I'm not allowed to share any more information on this matter.
I'll never ever use short avatars ever again.
We're on the same page, huh?
I really love all these gifts but I sure would like to know where these are coming from.
Alright, I don't know what you mean.
Just forget I asked. I'll find out myself.
Alright, next station, the town center!
Oh, is this a market over there?
Jepp! You'll find most of the \c[3]traders\c[0] around here.
...They are all over the place to be frank.
The catch: you first need to collect all the \c[3]required trade items\c[0] in the wild.
It takes time, but it's worth it.
Further up here is another important building.
This is the \c[3]Seeker Hub\c[0] or \c[3]Quest Hub\c[0].
Surprise: you'll find a lot of \c[3]quests\c[0] there!
... just like in many other places in town and elseway.
All those quests are optional, but the rewards usually make it worthwhile.
Hey Lea, are you still with us?
But she was really fast at the tutorial, almost beat me to it!
Just like they say -\. quiet ponts are deep, right?
Oui, oui.\. What about that main quest?
They kept talking about the \c[3]track of the ancients\c[0].
Oh right, I almost forgot about that.
You'll have to enter the Quest Hub, anyway.
There is a mandatory introduction for all new players.
There you'll get all your answers.
I suggest you go there right away and get it over with.

text.en_US: So, how was it, Lea?\. Enjoyed being in Space?

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560
EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: Well, now you should understand your task, being part of Track Walker and all.

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560
EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: By the way, Lea.\. Spheromancer?\. That's surprising.

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560
EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: They're pretty unpopular.\. Don't ask me why - they're fine balancing wise.

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: What about Pentafist?\. They are awesome, right?

desc: EventTrigger SchneiderPostExpo START IF tmp.centerEntered && plot.line >= 2560

text.en_US: Jepp!\. And I couldn't imagine you in any other class.
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]. I have keep watch on the market and protect our citizens, so please excuse me.
Good day, \v[lore.title.seeker].\. Are you the reinforcements I was promised?
Finally!\. We got some really pesky thieves at the markets lately who steals from both the stands and customers.
I just saw one committing theft at the stands but he was gone before I could catch him.
Now I have remain here and keep watch, so you gotta get him, you understand me?
Great. I saw him running towards the small park in the southeast, so go and get that crook!
The thief should be in the small park in the southeast, so go and get him!
Damn, I saw that he got away from you.\. What the hell happened there?
What's done is done.\. I saw him running southeast to a dead-end by the sea.
Make sure to catch him this time!
I saw him running southeast to a dead-end by the sea.
Make sure to catch him this time!
I hear he escaped again. You gotta finally nail him down, before we become a laughingstock!
Greetings, \v[lore.title.seeker]. I have keep watch on the market and protect our citizens, so please excuse me.
Ahh!\. What... what do you want from me?
I...\. I see.\. So you want to arrest me for my crimes?
Alright, it was only a matter of time.\. But I just had to earn money somehow for...\. for...\. here let me show you...
That mean scoundrel ran past here!\. You must have given him a solid spanking, good job!
Still not satisfied?\. Well, he ran towards \c[3]\v[area.autumn-area.name]\c[0] if you wanna whip him some more.
Young people these day... no manners, I tell you.
Young people these days have no manners.
Running through the streets \c[5]like they are fleeing from the police\c[0] without regard for others.
Hello, young lady.\. Did you also see this unkempt ruffian running through the street like a madman?
He was stinking of smoke and looked very suspicious, I tell you!
I saw him running to the southwest to a dead end by the sea if you wanna teach him a lesson.
All these buzzing in the town...
Back in my days everything was better.
Oh boy, here we go again.
People were nicer, greeting you on the street and everything.
Even the \c[5]name of This damn city\c[0] was better.
See? Look at this Seeker just staring at me, like I'm some decorative prop.
Ignore him, he just doesn't like it when things change.
You're damn right! \v[lore.unlock.rookie-harbor.Page-02-01]\c[3]Port Harbor\c[0] was such a nice name for this town.
They just change because of Seekers start their journey here.
The only real solace here is that I can still enjoy my fish with fresh apples.
I can't stand all these Seeker buzzing around.
The 5 Virtues mirror the foundation on which the Ancient's culture was build. Before a participant can begin the Track of the Ancients he must choose a virtue as part of their \c[3]Class\c[0].

\c[3]Triangle: The Virtue of Strength. \c[0]
Usually associated with the Element Heat.

\c[3]Square: The Virtue of Endurance. \c[0]
Usually associated with the Element Cold.

\c[3]Pentagon: The Virtue of Agility. \c[0]
Usually associated with the Element Shock.

\c[3]Hexagon: The Virtue of Wisdom. \c[0]
Usually associated with the Element Wave.

\c[3]Circle: The Virtue of Balance. \c[0]
This Virtue is not specifically associated with any elements and instead opts to balance each element.
To solve the mystery of the Ancients obtaining each element is the only way as far was we know.
Humankind found the moon planet Shadoon 30 years ago.
At first we tried to harvest to planet for its precious resources. We built mines, uncovered ruins and drilled into the ground.
While doing so, we also destroyed part of the Track of the Ancients. This activated the self-defense program of the self-sufficient system that kept the parkour intact.
After this it became almost impossible to harvest any more resources as the track itself fought back. We became aware of the finesse this system was build with.
The Goal of Operation Track Walker is to \c[3]research the Ancient Technology instead of destroying it\c[0].
We began to look for ways to be part of the Track itself. To have humans participate. To our surprise integrating ourselves into the system was easy.
We were even able to augment the Track to make it possible for humans, or \c[4]Seekers\c[0] as we now call them, to choose one of the 5 virtues and collect the 4 elements.
What happens when all four elements are collected and brought to the center temple in Shadoon is as of now unknown to us.
Even after 10 years of Operation Track Walker not a single Seeker has managed to solve the last puzzle.
Our only assumption is that the Ancients left their vast knowledge base for their descendants to find as some legends among them tell us of this.
Rhombus Square is the capital of humankind on Shadoon. Seekers start their journey in a custom course simulating puzzles on the Ancient's Track.
However in order for a Seeker to gain access to the city, he must first collect two elements on the Track of the Ancients.
The 4 Elements a participant has to collect are scattered all throughout Shadoon. Each one of them giving the Finder access to control the specific element.
These elements are \c[3]Heat\c[0], \c[3]Cold\c[0], \c[3]Shock\c[0] and \c[3]Wave\c[0]. This enumeration also reflects the order in which the elements are usually collected.
The Track of Ancients is a parkour game which played a large role in the Ancient's Society.
It is a self-sufficient system in which a contestant selects one of \c[3]5 Virtues\c[0] to collect 4 distinct \c[3]Elements\c[0].
Even now, after 1000 years this system is still intact and active.
The Ancients were a highly advanced humanoid society which lived on Shadoon approximately  10000 years ago.
For unkown reasons they left this planet. Only few native tribes remained.
The descendants of these tribes are known to us as the \c[3]Shads\c[0].

desc: EventTrigger ExpositionStart START IF tmp.theZone && plot.line >= 2556

text.en_US: Suddenly I was in the middle of space and this old geezer kept talking to me.
I suppose they wanted to pep up the boring introduction, non?
Oui, oui! \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0] it is!
Let's go back. Lukas is waiting.
By the way, Lea. I took the liberty to add a few more entries to your \c[3]encyclopedia\c[0].
For example... all past events and people we have met so far.
And a few insights on the technology, of course.
What?\. I just like to protocoll things.
In this room you can read more about the history of Shadoon and operation Track Walker.

I am sorry but there are no more Collecting Quests we can offer to you at the moment.
